text: By far the BEST pizza I've ever had! Whether you're a local or just visiting, you should make the trip. I've never had a bad meal here! Our favorite is the meat lovers pizza and garlic knots. Plus the cannoli's are AMAZING!!!!

One star may still be to good of a ranking for this place . If you want a meatball sub where the meatballs have been microwaved and it's so hot and rubbery it burns your mouth and the roll is soaking wet  then this is your place. Not only was the bread soaking wet it was burned also. If you get take out from this place make sure you check your order before you leave.
Great place, great pizza and service. It would be nice if they had a way to skip the line to pay if you are picking up an order, but that's my only complaint.

Close to work so it's super convenient. Small establishment but their food is great! I'd try anything from pizza... Fried zucchini... Fries ... Wings ... And fried ravioli is AmazeBalls! Besides the size and the severe wait times I'd give them a solid 4 star. But..... Although I don't mind greasy pizza make sure u don't go eating wearing your Sunday best! Gets messy! Bring wet naps lol ... Don't forget the great ranch too!

Always solid pizza here. 

They have great chicken fingers as well and I love the antipasto salad.  

Delivery guys are really quick and are always polite.

This is a well run business!

My husband and I went here for lunch on a Saturday. The place is clean and the employees are nice.  They had a deal for take out large pizza, so we jumped on it.  We ended up getting a large pepperoni, 12 garlic knots, 12 zeppolis, a side salad and a pineapple calzone. We paid almost 40, but felt it was a good deal for what we ordered. 

The calzone, for a small, was very large. Inside it had a mix of ricotta and mozzarella cheeses, so it was pretty creamy and sweet (especially with the pineapple). It came with hot marinara sauce. It was really good, but I didn't even get to half of it. Honestly, I was worried about my arteries with all that cheese haha! 

The pizza was good, but average. Pretty greasy, too. The oil leaked through the box on the car ride home. 

The garlic knots were average. Half were burnt on the bottom, the other were burnt on the top. We either got burnt bread or burnt garlic. 

The side salad was small, but the Italian dressing was good. It had olives, a half tomato, carrots, and a pepperchini. 

The zeppolis were the best part. The ended up giving us 24 instead of 12. They came hot and covered in powdered sugar. Just wish there was a chocolate sauce to dip it in.

We probably would go back if we were craving NY style pizza, but for now I'll stick with dominos.

Broadway Pizza is the best! We are from NY and have lived in Las Vegas since 1998 and have been going to Broadway ever since. I order from here weekly. I have turned co workers and friends onto Broadway as well. They have also catered our family events, it is just great food! Get the stuffed knots, chicken parm sub, meat parm sub and especially the pizza!! Enjoy!!

We had a party at our house and ordered 6 pizzas and a bucket of wings 
I have to say this was the best veggie pizza I have EVER HAD 
IT has broccoli on it !!  The white pizza was awesome . the wings superb. I could go on and on. Do yourself a favor and get yourself some Broadway pizza soon.

These guys are from New York and you could tell it when you taste of food as New York New York gets. I tried the pizza couple of days ago it was outstanding I tried the Ziti with meatballs unbelievably good as good as any five star restaurant the meatballs were outstanding great taste. They give you six garlic knots with dinner and it was very tasty garlic knots with very good. The owner is a very friendly and they treat you like family

Quick, easy and affordable.  Awesome lunch quickie if you are in the area.  Not sure if I would travel out of my way to come here.

Atmosphere is exactly what you think it would be in a ny pizzeria.
This place has the absolute best NY style pizza, and ranch! It's very inexpensive, and the service is quick.

Yet another Vegas hidden gem! The service was amazing, the food was excellent and the price was great. I'm not an Italian food fan, but my girlfriend is. This little place seemed perfect to try since they also have non-Italian options. 

We ordered the  chicken fingers and lasagna. Holy crap was the homemade ranch to die for and even as a not-so-big fan of Italian food, the lasagna was awesome!  Check this place out if you get the chance.

This is good new york style pizza. I dont even care for that style but i love a good pie when i get one. The garlic knots are very good. It reminds me of a pretzel more then a bread stick. Very good. If you like new york style then i must say this is good pie
Favorite slice in Vegas. Lived off their menu for half a decade. Never gets old. Friends relish when I bring a large pie from broadway. Love this place.

The food is  decent.  I had a bad experience with the woman at the register and she was totally rude!!!  I called and spoke to the owner, but he didn't seem to care....so I didn't care to go back to the business.  I would rather spend my money at a place that values it's customers.  Hey, we are the ones keeping them in business after all.

Great pizza and wings.  The sicilian pie is one of the best I've had since leaving new York.  I go out of my way to eat there or get delivered.  They deliver to a large area.  My place is flamingo and Decatur and my girlfriend is Rancho and 95... We get deliveries at both places...

Listen up! Just because the pizza restaurant people are from New York don't always expect the pizza will be good. There are plenty of awful pizza restaurants in New York. I know, I lived there most of my life. This place is just mediocre and I don't eat there any more.

I use to eat here a few times a week. There's nothing I can say that you can't read in other reviews, simply put, the pizza is great! The dining area gives me a real New York vibe and the staff are my kind of people. I'm a fan and the next time I go to Vegas again I'm certainly making a stop

I eat here a few times a month, sometimes once a week! Probably because it is close to work. I wish there was one in the southwest area. This place is a little pizzeria in a busy shopping strip mall. Which is the only complaint...location sucks. But there pizza makes up for it. I love how the staff seem to all be from NY... or at least have NY demeanor.  

Love the big slices and the ingredients are always fresh. Other items that are awesome besides the pizza is the pizza roll, salads, garlic knots (and stuffed garlic knots), and chicken fingers. You can't go wrong with this pizza joint. Highly recommended  A++++

Have been coming here since the 90's. This place hands down has some of the best pizza in Las Vegas! I keep saying that I'm going to try some of their other food but the pizza is just too good! I used to go to their other location on west Sahara, which closed a couple of years ago. With the economy improving, how about opening up a west side store again??

We came in last night around 8 after my step sons band performance and had the best experience! The service was the best I've had anywhere in a long time and the food was hot and delicious! We loved this place before but love it even more now!
Been coming here and eating here since I was a kid I always like there food from the pizza to the pasta it's worth every penny cheap good and fresh the garlic knotts are the best in town

Been going for 12 years owners are amazing food always on point thanks to Mario,  Anthony, Shannon as well Dave helped so much when having party's at VVA Vietnam Vetrans of America supplying us with great food an My Uncle Larry's service amazing thanks guys.        The Bartlett Boys

Spectacular pizza! I LOVE a good New York, thin crust pizza and the pizza here was one of the best I've EVER had. I just moved back to Vegas and am so happy I found my "IT" pizza spot!!! While I was here, the foot traffic did not stop, from dine-in to takeout orders. Not far from the strip, and worth the Uber or cab ride over.
Broadway is the best pizza in town!!!! Sauce is amazing and the staff is great!! Calzones are to die for just make sure to ask for extra sauce!!!!

As I walked up to the counter I noticed a half of a pizza with no box or anything under it to protect it from the surface of a desk it was sitting on.  I was just hoping that maybe it was a pizza that wasn't being sold.  While placing my order I saw one of the cooks was eating food where the food was being prepped.  I witnessed him licking his fingers and then sticking his fingers in a bowl and then licking his fingers again.  This is enough to keep me away.  It's a shame because this was our offices go to pizza shop.

Stopped by there today to get some wings.  They were old over cooked.  Service was very poor, my order was ready they put it on the oven and after five minutes I had to ask for the order.  Will never go back.

Not good I got a slice with olives n onions the slice looked like it was sitting for quite a while I had to touch the cheese to make sure there was any even on the slice . Then best part of a pizza is the gooeyness of the cheese this pizza looked as if it didn't have any . My toppings were raw on top & I don't know how when it took 20 min to come out. The crust was mediocre. A frozen pizza from the 99 cent store would have been better .

We love pizza and we know a good pie when we eat one and this is really a good pizza. We found it on Yelp as we were looking for an east coast type of pizza. We are from NJ and have pizza at home once a week. We know all the pizza places in middlesex county & beyond in NJ. We like our pizza thin crust, crispy bottom with a good sauce and real cheese and we found it here. Shannon the waitress is very friendly and provides good service and best of all we found out she is originally from NJ about 10 miles from where we are from. We also had the Cesar salad & it too was good the croutons were very good. If you like NY style pizza this is the place to go.
Bomb!!!! This was the best pizza I had ever had!!!! The crust was perfectly cooled and the sauce was to die for!! The staff was friendly and very personable. A++++

I eat here all the time, and always for the same thing. The lunch special. Two slices of Sicilian. Not only did they not have two slices available, but they told me I can have one now and another in 12 minutes once they made a fresh pie. So instead of waiting I substituted one for a regular slice. Upon eating 2-3 bites of my Sicilian, I became sick.  It was cold, greasy, and extremely unpleasant. I was a huge fan of this place before today. When I explained to the waitress how I became sick, she only offered me more "fresh" pizza. What happened to you broadway?

I LOVE THIS PIZZA!! Im usually very picky with pizza since I am not a big fan of the marinara sauce, but let me tell you...SOOOO GOOOD!. I usually order spinach and broccoli, which at first I was kinda unsure since Ive never had it in pizza. I can say that it has been made my number one all time fav. Now everywhere I go I ask for it ( eventhough they dont compare). The staff there is always very nice and curteous. They tend to get prettty busy around lunch time since the hospital and other medical offices are in the surrounding area.

The garlic knots are definitely what we always come for. Today i actually went for that and a slice. Now every place i order from (pizza-wise) I always ask for double/extra mushroom, and 9 times outta 10 it's kind of a letdown. Here, they covered my entire single slice of pizza, maybe even a little too much, but still much appreciated.
My boyfriend forgot to leave a tip today, but we will make it up to you guys next round...

I love this place it's easy to find a park they have the best Brooklyn Pizza in town I do not go anywhere else for pizza I only like the authentic Brooklyn style thin crust. Which they have and they also have the thick Sicilian. Love coming here they treat you like family always ask if you need anything else, sweet staff great place. Its kind of small,  but family friendly. I always come get the pizza by the slice which is huge, sometimes I cheat my diet and get two. They also have wings, sub's, pasta, sides salads and lunch specials. Came here to get my pizza fix throughout my pregnancy and I still come in now and the baby loves it too.

The best pizza in Vegas. 

My family and I are hooked! 

Anthony's white pizza is amazing. We've tried several things like their wings and chicken fingers and not once have we been disappointed. Thank you Broadway's.

I have been ordering food from Broadway for over 10 years. Today I treated my children to Cheese Pizza, Antipasto Salad, Wings, Tiramisu and Zeppolis. The pizza was flavorless. The salad was half the size it normally is. The wings were overcooked and sauce was forgotten. The Tiramisu was melted and bland. The Zeppolis were good. I called to let them know with no intentions of complaining until I made the phone call. The girl who listened was extrmely pleasant. She put me on hold to talk to the manager come to find out. That is where I lost it. The manager DIDN'T CARE ENOUGH TO GET ON THE PHONE!!  I have always recommended Broadway....never again. That phone call told me the manager-owner, whoever, doesn't care.  Not only were we disappointed but I was insulted. The food is no longer anything to recommend or purchase
Super friendly staff, awesome pizza! I have heard that everything on the menu is excellent, just haven't had a chance to try it all. We've enjoyed their pizza several times without disappointment.
Another visit.  The pizza is adequate but is still blander than I like. I had an especially surly waitress.
Real deal NY pizza. Lunch special 1 slice regular & 1 sicilian corner slice. Add a half order of knots.

Best Pizza in Vegas. Also, if you haven't had their chicken pasta soup with knots...you're missing out. The staff is great. They make u feel like you're eating at your family's. Love this place to pieces

Soooo yummy! Wow! I ordered a pepperoni and supreme for my family and they loved it. Cooked to perfection and friendly staff. When the kids are dancing while they eat, you know you've found "the one". With so many options how do you choose? You read reviews like this one and you say "yup! That's the place!" Say yes to these guys, we're all happy and full because they know what they're doing. They've got the pizza business covered.
This place has really good pizza, from taste to texture, also they are really friendly, i keep coming back to Broadway Pizzeria
garlic knotz are top in vegas, so is the alfredo! lots of great stuff to choose from! sicilian pizza i also love, what more to say? oh and the service is awesome
Best local pizza we've had to date. Thin crust and lots of flavor, not all dough.

Spaghetti, garlic knots, and salad for about $11.
Food was good, nothing too fancy. Hits the spot, good deal
I love their Philadelphia Cheese Steak sandwiches.  The best in Las Vegas.   Being from Philadelphia myself I know a good cheese - steak.
Great pizza i like the broadway special crunchy crust and great pizza over all, i get my pizza here once or twice a month.. good jb people

We moved downtown at Alta and Rancho. Found the place by accident. I think this is my second review..ever. I have picked up pizza and other things from here and used the delivery as well. I lived in NYC for 12 years and have tried pizza in every borough in NYC. Broadway's is the best NYC pizza in Vegas I have tried. Not only good but fantastic. Delivery is fast and it is always been hot. The wings are awesome. Perfect. Crispy skins, juicy drummettes with a spicy sauce, fresh and very hot. Always fresh and hot. The spaghetti with meat sauce delivered is a huge foil tray of a ton of spaghetti enough for two. Lots of meat and sauce. You can tell they care because they actually put sauce in the bottom first then spaghetti and then more meat sauce.
Comes with a small side salad cold and crisp. The small side salad came with dressing on the side. In the salad was crisp iceberg, romaine, purple cabbage, carrot shavings, sliced black olives, two tomato wedges and a large pepperoncini. Perfect. Ice cold. Almost forgot the best part. Garlic knots. I can't explain it good enough but wow. My family and I have ordered at least 20 times and it has always been delivered fast, hot and great. One of the things about any restaurant is consistency of product. Out of at least 20 times there have been zero surprises, changes or difference in quality or taste. Again tonight it was the same. Perfect.
I had to write a review. Yes it is that good.

Order ahead because the service takes FOREVER. It was an interesting experience to say the least. The service was good at first since the lady was pretty friendly. But when she got a manager to put into he discount for me, she started yelling at the first girl in front of me. The customer! I felt it was very inappropriate especially for a first impression. Unfortunately, all my coworkers sitting with me got their food and we're almost finished when mine finally came so I had to endure the awkwardness of eating while they had to wait for me. The food was ok. I got almost gluten free pizza (which was WAY overpriced). I felt it was greasy and ok. I've had better pizza elsewhere...

First let me say... I think that any business that is trying hard in this economy needs to have the love and support of all. No one on here has the right to knock any small business down. Secondly, I come from a pizza background. My father owned 7 sit down pizza parlors in California in the 70s and 80s. I also owned my own pizza parlor and have tried pizza all over the world. I witnessed my fathers sit down pizza parlors destroyed by the launching of Dominos pizza and delivery of the worlds worst pizza. It was then I realized the majority of Americans don't really know what good pizza is or what bad pizza is. These are the same Americans who love Dominos and Chuck E Cheese Pizza which are the worst pizzas on the planet. I have to start off my review saying the Garlic Knots are amazing! I'm always leary of garlic knots since the dough is always the same as the pizza dough and really how exciting can it be. I was wrong. They are great. The sauce a tad to thin for me was still flavorful and hot. Next the service was friendly and as good as can be expected in a pizza joint. Its funny a reviewer mentioned cops frequent there and a table full was sitting across from me. Now the Pizza...I'm a huge fan of Johns Pizza in New York...and I am also a huge fan of Lombardis and Grimaldis ..because I am a fan of coal ovens. I prefer the taste.  I grew up working the deck ovens that Broadway Pizza uses...I like the cornmeal on the bottom...I liked the crust here..is it the best ..no....is it in the top 40 of all time...sure....the cheese was good...the sauce again the same as the knots..not a huge fan...but it had a good flavor..now here's my only complaint. I prefer a better grade of pepperoni. Like Hormel..the kind that get a little crispy around the edges..I really wasn't feeling it. But hey that's just me..the Chuck E Cheese and Dominos pizza lovers of the world will think Broadway Pizza is in their top 5. If I was one of the normal yelping douchbags on here I probably would give less stars. But, I'm not and I can't knock anyone for trying in todays economy.  Try it for yourself..I am sure you will like it. I'm still on the quest in search of the ultimate pizza pie.

Everything tasted so good here!!!  We ordered pizza, chicken Parmesan, a sampler app and garlic knots and everything was excellent. The employees were very helpful and friendly in accommodating our party of six and the service was awesome!  Thank you!

I've lived in New York, and the South Bronx. This pizza reminds me of my two years spent there. Great food. A bit pricey, but you get a lot of food for what you order. Their cheese pizza deal is affordable, however, and it tastes great.

Since I moved out here from ny, it was very hard to find a good place for pizza until I stumbled this place when I got a coupon in the mail for it one day and decided to try it and I haven't been disappointed since.

I like the atmosphere, its not too big, a little noisy and you can smell the fresh food. Normally I always order a pizza, always comes out right and tastes great. Also I am a big fan of the grilled chicken roll. Just enough cheese in it and always generous with how much chicken is in there. Also the chicken parm for dinner with garlic knots is excellent also.

I like going in there at night when you get waitress service and you can relax while watching a game before the food comes out also. I took my girlfriend also for the first time and she loved it and its the only pizza place she will go to now. Its a little slice of home and glad I found this place!

I always enjoy stopping by to grab a large cheese pizza and garlic knots.  Always very friendly and the pizza is great.  Lunch specials are awesome and the place is always packed so it's hard to find a table while all the medical staff from the neighboring hospitals come over.
The Broadway special fantastic for the price -fresh, hot, great crust.  and everyone is super friendly.

Had a taste for pizza in LV, a bartender recommended this joint. Very impressed. My veggie pizza was not greasy and was loaded chock full of spinach, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, etc This is not factory food, this is homemade goodness. Plus if you get a pizza to go they give you a sheet of coupons some of which are really good deals, actually, and also they had a whole bunch of specials they were running. Would return happily. Recommended.

If I was somehow transported here and asked, "where are you?" I would answer Long Island, NY. The smell, look and of course the taste of this place and their food, everything is authentic NY. 

I've grown accustomed to being disappointed by places with names like "Joey's NY Pizza" or "5 Boroughs Pie" so the name Broadway Pizza didn't quite translate to greatness for me. The signage was the first bright spot. White letters stuck on a black pinboard...so far so good. The lunch specials were impressive, I went with the 2 slices and a soda for $5.99. Side note, they also have Sicilian, a welcome option. Ordered and took a seat to watch some NYG coverage, noticed the Giants flag, smiled a huge cheesy (pun intended) smile. This place is legit! Slices were brought over nice and hot on 2 paper plates. They were seriously awesome. Perfect amount of cheese, sauce and perfectly foldable. 

I can't wait to go back and try a sicilian slice and the garlic knots that have gotten rave reviews below. I was so pleased with this place, it will definitely hold me over until my next visit home to NY. If you could get Newsday here, that would be the crowning jewel.

Great pizza.  Great chicken wings (I asked if they can give me naked wings with sauce on the side and they said no problem). Great garlicky ranch dressing.  Very friendly people. New York memorabilia on the walls.  This is my new go-to pizza place next time I am in Vegas.

Came for lunch today. Pleasantly surprised!
Pizza was good (not fabulous) but really good. Now, the fried ravioli.... Out of this world. Best I've had, ever.  Service was excellent, staff very friendly.

So the other day, I was starving at work and had no idea what to get for dinner. One of the girls was going out and had no idea what she was getting either. She was telling me that it was gonna be pizza or sandwiches. She was telling me that she was probably gonna get pizza from Broadway Pizzeria. I told her that I had never heard of the place but pizza did sound good. So we drove over to the pizza place and were debating whether or not to go in or get something else. I told her that I was debating about going to Starbucks as well. Well needless to say, we went into Broadway Pizzeria and each got a slice of pizza and chicken fingers. She ordered a slice of cheese pizza and original chicken fingers with ranch. I ordered a pepperoni slice with mild sauce on my chicken fingers and got ranch to go with it... I LOVED IT... One of the other girls at work was telling me about the spaghetti from there as well... OMG.. I am gonna have to try that next. We were so happy to hear that deliver that we are making plans to order so from there and have it delivered. The pizza was kinda greasy, but it was fantasticly delicious. The chicken fingers were even better. Thanks to friend, I found a new pizza place to order pizza from instead of pizza hut or dominos.
Excellent pizza! I drive from the west side of town to pick it up. Reminds me of the pizzerias I grew up with back in Staten Island.

THE LAST TIME I ORDER HERE!It is usually my favorite place to order when it comes to pizza, but the last time I called for delivery, I got the nastiest attitude  form the girl that answered the phone....Whitney. I asked her for wet hot wings  and she response wit well we only have med or hot... And I told here I wanted them x hot and wet that is y I just said wet. I also asked her for a SIDE OF RAVIOLIS... And she again gives me attitude and tells me they only have a dinner or a side of fried RAVIOLIS. That's when I asked her here name she got really nerves and started giggling and saying o I just wanted to make sure... I told her it was okay and gave here my card info.... She was in such a hurry to get off the phone with me ,that she never repeated any of the given info and said the food would arrive in 45 mins........after 50 mins I get a phone call from the driver saying that the card # was wrong.... I repeated and asked him how come they didn't run it while she was taking my order and was my food ganna be cold since he was still in the resturant ,And yet again I got some attitude from him saying no dear am on my way no after almost a whole hour. I live on Rancho and Washington and think it's ridiculous that my pizza took that long when I drive to there shopping center it takes me  no longer then 10 mins to get there. SO FINALLY AFTER ALMOST AN HOUR AND A HALF. The deliver guy gets there and recognizes me and now he wants to act like a sweetheart. We only tipped him like 2 dollars  and we did him a favor. Maybe it wasn't his fault but honestly the food was horrible my pizza was so cold I had to microwave every slice that we ate. The wings were what I think is mild and DRY VERY VERY DRY!!!!!!This is why I we'll never waste my money on this place that has employees who act like there doing my a favor instead of being thankful I once was the reason for them to get a pay checks! If I could rate with no stars I would.....NEVER AGIAN!

This review is long overdue. I've eaten here at least once every 1 1/2 weeks for the last 2 years and the pizza is always good. The staff is always friendly and the pizzas come out the oven piping hot and delicious. I prefer to dine-in since they have (2) flatscreen TV's and a comfortable atmosphere. One of these days I'm going to try something other than pizza, but the pizza is so damned good.

One of the best pizza places that I have found in Las Vegas and that is a huge compliment since I'm originally from NY so I love NY style pizza which they have. I usually get their white pizza which is good too. I got their garlic knots for free with the check in offer so they hooked it up. Awesome service. I am so glad I found this place to be my go to pizza place.

This place is awesome!! We got wings and pizza by the slice. For 20 we got 12 wings and 4 slices! Great deal! They make their food with love and you can watch them toss the dough from the dining room. Definitely would come here again.
Delicious!! Best gluten free pizza in town! Great prices too. Happy to support a moms n pops shop. Definitely recommend this place
Their pizza is fantastic! We have eaten here occasionally over the past decade, and they never disappoint.

I love this pizza. I love their chicken wings! It is seriously the best pizza I have had in Vegas! Only 4 stars because I wish it was a little more affordable. I love their service and dining area. I wish they would open a second location in the summerlin area.

We have ordered pizzas from here several times and have always been pleased. Nice Brooklyn-sized slices with fresh ingredients and homemade crust. I've never eaten in the restaurant, but it's always been a great place for takeout.

Tonight we thought we'd try something different, so we ordered other items off the menu. My husband had the Italian Combo sandwich, and I had the lasagna. We ordered these as to-go items, and they both traveled well in the takeout containers. The sandwich was flavorful, with fresh bread and a good selection of meat. The lasagna came with a side salad and an order of six garlic knots. LOVE the knots, and I can't imagine eating the pasta without them! I've had better lasagna, but this was pretty good for a storefront takeout -- and it was a LOT better than I could have pulled off at home. Plus the portion was big enough for us to have leftovers, and lasagna is always better the next day!

I'm not a New Yorker by any means, but for this Nevada gal (by way of the Midwest and Texas), this is some pretty tasty Italian fare. (Better than Pizza Hut and Olive Garden, if nothing else.) Try the pizza, but don't be afraid to order off the menu.

This place has a real New York Pizzeria vibe going for it, right down to the New York accents flaunted by some of the employees. While I've never visited New York, if the food is half as good as Broadway Pizzeria, you can count me in! We ordered the Hero Sandwiches since they were on special that day. They were excellent, my favorite being the meatball. After seeing the traditional New York style pizza slices come out the window however, I was really wishing I'd gone for some good ol pizza! I'll be trying a slice of the goods next time I'm in.

Food was fantastic but, the BEST was the service! Shannon was our host, server, and everything. She was on a timely manner, ask how everything was without being to much of a bother, and very very great personnality. Her suggestions on the menu were best and the food. ... AMAZING

I love the place and the food, there is a lady with black hair and pregnant with a bad attitude. Since I placed my order and tossing stuff angrily. Good food has to go with good attitude... Not sure if I would return but if I happen to come by and see here I will definitely not stop by...
Very good pizza and fast delivery service! Not too saucy and very cheesy. The slices are thin and large..great vegas pizza option.

Eh, I'm kind of on the fence about this place, I went in for wings because I've heard they're so good. I was very disappointed I got them medium and to go. I work about 4 mins away and by the time I got back there was no sauce on the wings and the fries weren't good either.. the service was pretty friendly, staff seemed to take a little more time with familiar faces as oppose to new folks. Blah.. might not visit this place again. Again, I only tried the wings
I'm born and raised in New York so I know good pizza. This is the best in town. Love this place. Been coming here for over 10 years and hope I will be for another 10 more. Love you Broadway Pizzeria!

The closest you can get to New York pizza. No doubt. I have tried many things on the menu and they were all great. Garlic knots are ok not the best. The stuffed ones are a different story. They have TASTYKAKES. I was so happy when I found out.

As good as it gets for traditional New York pizza in Las Vegas.  This coming from someone who is married to a New Yorker.  We can't get enough of this place (our waist lines say different)!

Great food across the board.  Want something different than pizza?  Try the eggplant parm!  Garlic knots are excellent and can never go wrong with their wings.  Great central location for the valley and a large pie take out special which can't be beat.  Sums up to an excellent experience with good food and friends!

I have been coming here for over 15 years now. Same great food and same familiar faces. The service is amazing. It feels like a authentic NY pizza parlor. They remember you and greet you as you come in. Come check it out. Their garlic knots are really good too! Enjoy fellow yelpers :)

Huge fan of this place! We always go for the lunch special--2 slices and a drink. They stay true to great, New York-style pizza. 

After 5 they serve you at the table with the same great pizza. I recommend trying the garlic knots if you have the carbs!
Love their pizza and garlic knots. Super Yummy and fulfilling! Everyone is friendly and the service is fast. I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a new pizza place.

The girl behind the counter made nice with the guy before me and then as he walked away preceded to call him a f*kn retard. He of course couldn't hear her say it, but that's my initial visit of this place. Who knows maybe they have a love/hate relationship I didn't know about. Just seemed a little uncalled for, and who knows what she may have called me as I walked away.

I went with the spicy chicken pizza roll that someone on yelp mentioned. It was edible but nothing great. Maybe it wasn't my taste. I also ordered a half dozen garlic knots to see what all the rage was about... They were not for me either. The sauce seemed to taste unseasoned like a can of tomato sauce. 

I will probably give this place another shot at some point and another review as well... but not anytime soon.

Never been to New York but want New York Pizza? 

No worries! This pizza is it. 

This pizza is the real deal. Sauce / Cheese ratio is there, crust is there. Everything is what you could want in a pizza. And the best part? 


Its working man's prices. Pizza is after all working man's food. Don't pay double for inferior pizza downtown!

I am a creature of habit when it comes to Broadway Pizza. The Hawaii it is, for me! I first found this place on yelp when I was at the outlets and looking for a lunch spot. My first experience was a dine-in experience and it is your typical "pizza place"  dining experience (diner booths, small, loud, etc.). The pizzas were delish! I became hooked when I offered to bring some pizzas to a friend's house one afternoon and I stopped by there. I ordered one Hawaiian and one with various meats and veggies for the hefty meat eaters in the group (I am not a fan of sausage, olives, etc.). The others delved into the "everything" pie, I began with the Hawaiian and when I wanted more it was practically gone. The Hawaiian was the winner! I've never had any problems with an order, with the service or with the quality. 

A good pizza place is a great find!

When it comes to pizza, it's not Vomito's or Pizza Slut... it's Broadway Pizzeria for me! It's about as close to New Yawk pizza without having to go there. When I came back to Vegas on home leave from Kwajalein, it was at least one night a week during my vacation where we stopped at Broadway for a couple of slices after my younger brother got off work at the Palace Station. 

I still owe 'em a picture wearing my 'Peace, Love and Pizza' T-shirt from Broadway Pizzeria on the beach at Kwajalein. I'll make sure to get one done before I come back!

Best pizza in town. The big squares are amazing. The pizza here is fresh baked and taste delicious.  They have awesome choices and everything is home cooked good. The spaghetti with meat sauce is ample sizing and has lots of meat in the sauce. The garlic knots are soft and full of flavor. The lasagna just melts into your mouth and you cant help but devour it
Has to be my go to pizza joint in Vegas. We always recieve great service and the food is always spot on.

OK... I'm not from NYC, but have visited there recently.  I L*O*V*E this place.  It has a flavor that I can't quite put my finger on, but it took me right back to the little pizza place in Brooklyn right by Pratt.  The people who work there aren't overly friendly... but like another person wrote.. this isn't a high-class, gourmet, snooty pizza place.  The kids behind the counter are consistently polite, and I have never had any problems ordering my food and getting it home hot and wonderful.  I have never eaten in there... I usually order the pie, slip into Smiths for a bottle of wine and a few groceries.. and by the time I get my groceries my food is done.  I have never tried the garlic knots... but we are getting a couple of pizzas for dinner tonight, so I think it's high-time I treat myself (my kids will probably eat most of them :-)

The garlic knots are amazing. Order the zeppoles at your own risk. They are fantastic, but there is no personal-sized order. 

Sausage, meatballs, and pizza are all excellent. Locally owned. Great little spot. And the owner's son plays the Beatles on his keyboard a few times a month.

Great service.  Very small.  They moved tables to accommodate our group of seven.   There was another large group nicely accommodated in the very small space as well. 

Ordered garlic knots, meat lovers and cheese pizza.  

I was very excited to try this As the reviews said they had the closest thing to authentic New York slices.  I would have to disagree.  A good New York slice should be pliable when folded and not have the crust dry and break when folded.  By the second half of the slice, the crust is noticeably dry and bland.  It was fine pizza, but I would not go out of my way to eat there again.  One diner was a long time diner and eaten there for 20 years.  I guess this place has a following, but having been to New York a dozen times, this didn't make me nostalgic.  My hunt for a good vegas pizza continues.

If I can describe broadway pizzeria in one word it would be Tasteless. A friend of mine told me about broadway and how good it was. I stopped by there today ordered a slice of pepperoni and hot wings with fries. The price is reasonable for what you get but the pizza it self doesn't have much flavor. The dough didn't taste like anything which I found surprising most of these mom and pop pizzerias make there own dough. My wings were not hot at all they were dry on the sauce and over cooked. The fries were great I think that's the only thing they got right today.
Great restaurant but the massive tip jar plus asking for gratuity on the receipt is a little tacky. - from an anonymous friend
By far the best pizza and wings in Vegas. Delicious home made ranch. My first choice every time!The owners are good people... You can't go wrong with Broadway pizzeria.
Great customer service. Ordered via phone to have delivered and the two folks we talked to were helpful and knowledgeable.

Great food and pizza!  Kids had their slice pizza with a salad. I had the Grilled Chicken Sandwich, it was on the perfect sub roll that seemed from scratch. Mushrooms, Onions and melted Provolone cheese made this large sandwich yummy! We will be back sooner rather than later. Glad you are still around!
After having had to fast 12 hours for bloodwork this was the BEST PLACE to be!  Enjoyed the BEST PIZZA IN LAS VEGAS again!!!!!!  Thanks Broadway!!!
Great crust- Bakers pride oven- good cheese- just right- lunch specials by the slice- delicious! This may be my favorite yet!

Let me first say I been coming here for almost 6 years already and man do I love this place. I dont eat here as often as i use to but when i do eat here i love it more and more the portions are amazing, the food taste fantastic, and the customer service is awesome. They are all so friendly and happy and energetic. I always get pizza and wings. Whenever i have a party at the house i always order the bucket of wings and man it does justice for a family of 5, theres never anytjing left i can tell you that much.
One of my favorites ..near work..cheap and good! Best meatball sub ever ! And the pepperoni rolls were good!

Choose this place per Yelp reviews. Was not disappointed. Very easy to get a table on Saturday night. Service was quick and staff was attentive and efficient. Had to try the garlic knots since this was one item mentioned over and over again in other reviews. Knots were garlicky and did not disappoint. Next we ordered lasagna, ziti with meat sauce and spicy sausage and spaghetti and meatballs. Lasagna was tasty, sausage had a bit of a kick- which is what I was looking for and meat sauce was plentiful.  The portions didn't disappoint. We easily have leftovers since we also received salads with our entrees in addition to the garlic knots. The cheese Sicilian pizza was super cheesy and the sauce had a good flavor to it. Small mom and pop restaurant in a strip mall with plenty of parking. Next time we visit Las Vegas I hope to try one of their sandwiches. Thanks for the great dinner!
Great little pizza place in Las Vegas. Their calzones are some of the best I've ever had as well as extremely friendly staff.

The pizza is top in town for me other than Due Forni in summerlin...
But by far the garlic knots always come out fresh and hot... And prices are cheap for the nice portions you get...

First star: I'm in agreement with everyone else that the ranch dressing here is like crack. It's garlicky and delicious, and I'm not normally a ranch fan.

Second star: I appreciate that they sell both Neapolitan and Sicilian pies, both whole and by the slice. Get a classic cheese slice, or add a topping. If you opt for meatball, it's a good amount, chopped and spread out over the slice. Neapolitan crust is crisper than expected but the cheese and sauce were very light and not particularly flavorful.

Third star: they have several different lunch combos, available Mon-Fri til 3PM. Most are $7-10, including various pastas, salads, sandwiches, and slices. They get surprisingly busy during a mid-week lunch, but service is quick and efficient.

Tried this place and it was amazing! Great flavored and nice staff. Loved it!!!

The salad was really fresh, we're supposed to get there two minutes after the pizza sauce seemed really fresh as well, and had a great flavor to it. And again, the service was really great.

Hit the spot late night pizza. Had a craving for pizza but didn't feel like paying $40 for Bellagio room service and CPK was $17 for a small at the Mirage. So we found this online and figured we'd give it a try. 

We had to wait an hour for delivery, but the delivery guy was willing to wait in Bellagio lobby for us to come down. Got a HUGE deep dish veggie that more than stuffed us (could have fed a whole family if five easily and was way too much for two people) that was delicious n $28 w delivery and tip, all said and done. We'd have left overs for days if we weren't flying back tomorrow!

Great find if u feel like being lazy without paying Vegas Strip prices.
Very good plain - Jane neighborhood pizza shop.  The pizzas and calzones were very tasty and huge.  Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

SO good!!!! Their pizza is awesome but recently I've become a big fan of their entrees. The Lasagna, Cannalloni and Philly Cheesesteak are excellent.  There's so many other entrees options which I'll continue to try. Never disappoints. Their Marinara sauce is BOMB so if you get pizza or garlic knots, get an extra large side of marinara (you can thank me later). Good old school feel when you dine in. Dining in, to-go or delivery, it rocks. Its always homemade and it's always delicious... Lucky for me, I live down the street

I found this place under not so great circumstances (daughter in the hospital for 8 days), but I can't stop telling people how great it is. Great pizza at a reasonable price. There are a number of good lunc specials that are hearty enough to fill anyone up. The staff, while ruff on the outside, are truly good people. They helped make a difficult time a little easier. I can't thank them enough.

It has been nearly three months since my daughter has been out of the hospital and we've had a chance to go back to Broadway a few times. It's nowhere near where I live, but as long as they're around, I will keep coming back.

Thanks guys!

The ranch is amazingly delicious. It has a great garlicky flavor and it's probably the best ranch I've ever had. 

I walked in 3/3/16 around 6:30 and placed a to-go order. I got a small calzone with pepperoni and fresh garlic, and an order of hot fingers and fries. I also got a couple extra sides of crack ranch, and my total was just about $22. The calzone was everything you could want from a 'zone. It was stuffed with ricotta, mozzarella, pepperoni and garlic and came with a side of "sauce" which is their marinara. It was hot and cheesy and delicious. I would definitely order this again, but next time I'd go easy on the garlic because I could have killed a vampire shortly after eating. 

As for the fingers, you can see from my pix they half-assed the sauce and I basically ended up with plain fingers with a drizzle of hot. You can tell no fucks were given in the preparing of my fingers and although it's a fairly small issue, it's the principle of the matter. I spent $9.25 for fingers and fries and didn't even care to eat them after that.  Would I go back? Yes. That calzone was really good, but I will definitely check my order before I leave next time.
Best calzone!!! So good. The food is always amazing. Delivery takes an hour so I would rather call ahead and pick it up myself.

The best Pizza in Vegas. My style is the closest you will get anywhere on the west coast!  Food and service is amazing!!! Been going and having food delivered from this establishment since they opened!!!!!

I drove across town to get NY Sicilian style pizza from here.  It's exactly like the pie you'd get in NY.  They even serve Sfincione if you want the same stuff they serve in Sicily. I prefer the NY version myself.

Stay Away from here!!  Don't eat Here!!

I wish they had a Zero Star rating!!! 

Horrible, Horrible!! 

Our party of four ordered pizza and an order of fries to be delivered to our hotel off the downtown strip on Friday night, on recommendation from the bell desk. First when we called to order they said it would take anywhere from 45min-1 hour to get to us, and we would have to wait in the lobby for the driver. 

OK, so it's our weekend in Vegas, and we had to wait in the lobby for an hour, I thought OK.. I can see that, it's a busy night with traffic and all. So we ordered our pizza, and waited, waited and waited.. Did I say we waited??? OK, it took over two hours for the driver to deliver our food. We all rushed up stairs to eat, cause we were starving. The pizza was $20 bucks, and the fries $3. 

We got up to the room and the freaking pizza was stone cold. We opened the french fries, and OMG, so nasty.. The fries were drenched in grease from sitting, stone cold, and rubbery, not eatable. No one dared to touch those.. We did eat the pizza, but because we where hungry.. It wasn't good either.., tasted like it sat around for a few hours.. you know those party days where you wake up the next morning and eat a piece of pizza, a little stale, and hard.. yeah.. that's what I'm talking about. 

That night, I didn't want it to ruin my night, so we partied.. Anyways the next morning I got to thinking that was just wrong.. Why did we pay $30 for crap food like that, and how can they have given us cold food?? 

I was very calm, and wanted to give the resturant some feedback to how I was feeling.

I called the restaurant, and before I could even tell the lady my complaint or what order I was calling about, she cuts me off and pretty much tells me I'm lying.. I've worked in customer service for over 15 years now and know the standard of how to treat a customer, blah blah blah, Oh I'm so sorry about that...smile.(wink).. but no,  I was really Mad by how rude she was treating me over the phone, and told her it's nice that her customer service skills don't included listening to the customer. I would not recommend this pizza place to anyone!! 

Stay Away! Unless you like cold food, rude employees, and enjoy waiting for hours... Seriously Zero Stars!!!

Fresh and delicious!  Try the spinach roll!  The place is small and nothing fancy but don't let that stop you. Prices are good and the food is great. It is very close to UMC medical center if you need to grab a quick bite to eat.

This was my absolute favorite local pizza spot for the last 7 or 8 years. My gold standard for local NY pizza - thin crust, floppy and foldable, just greasy enough to hit the spot without crossing the line. In the past year or so it seems like something is different - either the ingredients have changed or they took on some new guys to make the pizzas. The dining area has about 4 small booths, 4 large booths, 4 small tables and 4 large tables with 2 ceiling mounted TVs in the corners. It gets pretty noisy around lunch or dinner time. Prices are decent and the delivery time is about 45-60 minutes on average.

This is my all time favorite pizza place in Vegas - definitely true New York pizza. I have been eating here since they opened and will eat here until I die (or until they close...whichever comes first).

Thin crust with the best cheese I have ever tasted. I don't know what kind of cheese they use but it's awesome. The garlic knots are warm buttery love! 

It's especially great after a night of drinking...they're open late, so we usually pick up a pizza on the way home from

Best pizza in Vegas. Not the best pizza ever, but it's damn good.

Not a huge fan of the garlic knots though... tried it twice, still 'meh'. But their pizza... mmm. Their cheese pizza is incredible. And their white pizza is good too...Even better reheated the next day! haha But didn't care for the meat lovers... too salty. It is a bit out of the way, but it's where I go for my pizza fix.

I just popped in here for a quick slice while on my lunch break and Broadway gets a SOLID 4 stars. 

There is no way this pizza is "the best pizza in Vegas," but it is definitely authentic, east coast style, delicious, and reasonably priced! 

I ordered the 2 slice lunch special, garlic knots, and a side of ranch. Their ranch dressing is definitely homemade and UNBELIEVABLY GOOD. The pizza came out cooked perfectly, thin with a slightly crispy crust (there's nothing I hate more than soggy, under-cooked pizza) and a good ratio of cheese to sauce. I would have liked a little more sauce, but that's personal preference! 

The garlic knots were really, really good. Dusted with garlic powder, not overpowering, and the marinara sauce they came with perfectly complimented the garlic flavor. 

This place is super busy during the lunch hour, but has a nice cosy atmosphere if you have time to sit and eat. There are a few tables and booths, but it is first come first serve so between 12-2: good luck! 

Overall, I definitely enjoyed my lunch.... but I am still on the hunt for that perfect slice. :)

true feeling of a nyc pizza joint. the attitude, atmosphere, accent, and yes the pizza. thin and crunchy bottom. oil dripping off the cheese. not much more to say than go try it out. if you dont like their pizza then go back to chicago deep poop or buy that poo poo johns.

Been here many times over the years, especially since it's so close to work which makes it convenient for lunch or a quick snack. I usually just get the slices when I'm here, which are $2 per slice of cheese and 40 cents for each topping you'd like on it. The pizza here is so good that I sometimes am good with just getting cheese. 

The pizza here is New York style which means it's large, thin and super greasy but oh so delicious. Service here is pretty good even when it gets crowded and pizzas usually come out pretty fast. They have other Italian style food here, such as chicken parmasean, pastas, sandwiches, salads, etc,  if you're not in the mood for pizza.

I use to love this place. Their wings and customer service was to brag about...
I guess I can still brag about their ranch. Ordered wings and waited about 25 minutes, there goes my lunch time. When I did get it though, woah I was amazed! Wings were SUPER dry. It looked like they just drizzled the sauce. But the fries.... let me talk about those fluffy not fully cooked and zero seasoned fries. 

I went to ask for sauce and three of the employees looks at me funny. Well I wouldn't have to ask if you had put sauce. I walk back and SURPRISE its marinara sauce. I've about had it at this point. I had THREE wings and TWO fries. 

Complete waist of $12. Complete disappointment.
Great pizza service is pretty good love the feel and the environment  this place delivers

I give the BP five stars. 
The pizza is hot and great. Ive never been in the location myself but I found it on yelp and I asked the husband to go. And I was pleased with the outcome. I give it five stars.

This place at night is great! the staff is friendly, the food is great and the service is great too!  During the day it is a whole different story.......the service is terrible and the waitress acts like she would rather be anywhere else....been going down hill for awhile.

As a native New Yorker, Broadway is about as close as you can get to true NY pizza! Friendly staff and great food here, and the carry out special for a cheese pie is great! Never a disappointment here!
Friendly staff, clean place, open late, delicious garlic knots, and decent NY style pizza.

Best pizza I've had in Vegas so far.  Hands down!
I'm from New York City - pizza is kind of a big deal and it's one of the foods I'm actually REALLY picky about! I know good pizza...I expect good pizza...and only a few places pass the test!
When I moved to Vegas several months ago, I began my quest to find the best pizza.  My craving got the best of me at work one day, and I decided to Yelp the nearest pizza place to my office...it turned out to be Broadway Pizzeria.
At first, I was hesitant.  Broadway is located in a strip mall I'm not very fond of (awful parking lot and the occasional shady character)...but I proceeded to take my chances.
I am now a regular and tell all my friends about Broadway! I have yet to try their non-pizza items (I will soon!) but every slice I've gotten from them has been a piece of heaven in my mouth - absolutely delicious!
Can't wait to go grab some on my lunch hour here today - thanks Broadway! :-)

So I born and raised in the boogie down Bronx and to find a good place that makes silicosis pizza like home is next to impossible but Broadway is ridiculously good. If you go anywhere else ur just dumb.  The wing and fingers are so delicious and the ranch I can't even describe it so good. You could drink it.  So wherever u are in Vegas find ur way to this pizza place !!

Among the best pizzerias in LV.  The Broadway Special is the best combo pie I've had in this town, especially in size and price (16" for $18.50 is a great value, right?).  

Just wish they were located in my neighborhood.  Outside of Red Rock Pizza, the rest are bleh.  Hey, Anthony and Mario, maybe you guys would consider opening a location in Summerlin?  Please?
Awesome pizza awesome place.  this is a must eat while in vegas.  the people here rock!!!!
Went there with my kids. Staff was really friendly and our server was on point! Cooked our wings to perfection and had an amazing pizza! I was impressed and will be back! This place is legit!

Here visiting from San Diego . My family and I had a taste for real New York style Pizza, then we happen to come across Broadway Pizzeria , we ordered a large Pepperoni and sausage, and I sincerely must say that their pie was delicious exactly what we were looking for , the staff was friendly and courteous. I would highly  recommend Broadway Pizzeria to anyone who is looking for NY Style pizza.

Broadway Pizza exemplifies made to order and delivery of product. Service is excellent and offers consistent timely deliveries. It should be noted that pizza styles and preferences obviously vary wildly. Broadway offers fresh ingredients and toppings with their pie. Aside from ingredients, the crust will make and break my overall experience. The pie must allow for a perfect balance of dough, slash heating methods and this place finds a winning crust equation. I highly suggest their vast menu options, from basic cheese to their Broadway special.
Excellent food every time. Seating is limited, but to be expected when food is this good. Full menu.

The five stars is strictly for the garlic infused ranch sauce. #%^*! 

The ranch sauce here is stupid -wicked- good! I'm addicted to the ranch here and I would just come here and buy a tub of it if I could. It's truly insane. 

It's a homemade, rich, buttery buttermilk ranch, but wait, that's not all...infused with roasted garlic flavor?!? I honestly don't know what they put in their ranch, but it set off our pizza dinner to a whole new level. It's what ranch dreams are made of. Flavor rating: 5/5

The pizza- extra hooked up with cheese, toppings were decent, crust not too shabby. Overall, I would dabble again in their pizzas. Flavor rating: 3/5

The spicy buffalo wings- small, dry, overcooked, and the seasoning was not memorable. Flavor rating: 1/5

The garlic knots- 12 free knots with a purchase of a large pizza! That's called a hookup ya'll. The knots were flavorful and moist. I dunked them like crazy in the house ranch. So good! Flavor rating: 5/5

I honestly feel that the ranch enhanced the pizza, wings, and the knots by a lot. Without their house ranch, I would be a sad panda.

It is absolutley unacceptable to say an order will be delivered at a certain time and then not even have the courtesy to call and say it will be late.   And the solution the manager offered..." well maybe next time you order we can do something for you" what a load of crap.   Plus the pizza was super greasy.  Def not ordering again .

The best pizza in town. You could really taste the quality in the pizza toppings. They have good size portion on there chicken parmigan and you get to choose what kind of pasta comes with it. This was the second time coming here and I haven't been disappointed.

Pizza is universally loved. And pizza holds a serious cultural position in the United States in particular. It is not rare to meet someone in America who has a testimony to the superiority of a small mom-and-pop hole-in-the-wall joint back in one of New York City's five Burroughs. New York pizza is the standard by which pizza is judged. Chicago style is also important, but does not hold the prestige of a NY pie.

Vegas is a city with deep New York ties. Most of Las Vegas's Founding Fathers had deep ties to the New York mafia. Hoping for a baptism and a fresh start in this faraway desert, gangsters often demanded that if they were forced to live in this arid wasteland, at least they should be provided with their creature comforts: a Maria Callas recording, a fine chianti, and maybe a pizza pie.

But the crime bosses at La Cosa Nostra were having none of it. The bosses were nervous Italian culture was becoming watered-down and too Americanized. They  issued an edict in 1952 that made it a crime punishable by death to make an authentic NY pie west of Cincinnati. Sinatra and Dino would have to endure their forsaken oasis without the cuisine they loved. But happily they were not barred from showgirls, booze, or gambling.

Vegas Italian food suffered (see Battista's Hole in the Wall).

Finally, the edict was lifted shortly after Gotti was imprisoned for life. Broadway Pizzeria on Rancho and Charleston opened 90 days later. Happiness ensued.
Great pizza!! I wish they had online ordering app. We would order more often. My son is a pickey eater and will only eat Broadway Pizza....

The go to place for lunch right around the corner from my work. 
Food wise: i love their pizza: it's cheesy and the crust is just so crunchy, the garlic knots are buttery, wings and fries cooked and season right. 
Reasonably priced and Delivery is quick.

Best pizza in Vegas if you love pizza then you need to take a trip to this location.
I have been coming to this pizzeria for years.
The customer service is great. The selection of food is very authentic for the atmosphere they provide in the location. 
If you eat at the restaurant it does feel like you're  back in New York just eating a slice of pizza or even a whole pie.
If I can come and eat here once a month I would but my schedule tends to be very busy. But I highly recommend if you love pizza to come to Broadway's pizzeria.

Hands down, best pizza in Vegas. I've tried many different pizzas here and none have disappointed! The garlic knots are to die for and the ranch is killer. 

The service is always good- not superrrr friendly, but with food that good, I guess it doesn't matter!

I haven't tried their lunch and dinner specials in house, as I've always taken it to go, but it always looks really yummy. I'll def be going in to try the other options available.
So good! Their Italian dressing is delicious, the wings are great, and the garlic knots are really good too. The people that work there are super friendly!

We went stricktly for the NY pizza since we are from NY.  We got a large cheese pie and were dissapointed.  The NY style part was fine - meaning we loved the thin, chewy crust and the grease.  But the sauce had a weird flavor to it - definitely did not taste like pizza sauce back east.

If you love pizza and.or good Italian food, be sure to check out Broadway pizza; they have authentic New York style pizza, as good as we had back home, and in some cases, better, The portions are enormous, the staff friendly and attentive, and eating there makes you feel like home.

I already loved the delivered pizza. Never been inside. Inside there is seating with a waitress who us awsome!  Try the Sicilian Pizza... omg the best thick crust in town. Meatball pizza is fantastic. But today I'm doing pepperoni. ... well so much for the diet :)
The broadway pizza is yummy. The knots are a cheap yummy eat. $3 for 6 knots cheap, cheap!

Pretty good chicken fettuccine alfredo, the salad was just a basic salad nothing special, the garlic knots were not to famous to me, nothing really special about the pizza. The server could have been a little more faster with refills instead of me trying to get her attention when it was just my booth and another booth taken. Bill was high at 33$ not including the tip. Just wasn't worth it to me in my eyes. Wouldn't go here again. Only good thing was the chicken fettuccine alfredo came with the side salad and the garlic knots. Other then that blah.

Excellent Pizza And thee Best Chicken Fingers and Ranch dressing in Las Vegas!! The garlic knots and sauce are the best I have ever tasted and dont leave  this  restaurant without them even if you are carbin it with a pizza get the knots too!!! Cheers to Anthony and Mario for feeding UMC Staff and MDs for 20 years!!

So, the first time I came here, I ordered a pepperoni pizza. It was the closest thing to a great New York-style pizza that I had ever had in Las Vegas. The crust was crispy on the bottom, but not too crispy. The cheese had a nice stretch without it falling off of the pizza and there was ample grease (which I usually blot off). Within the same week, I went back and tried a pizza with ham and jalapeno. The sauce, toppings, and cheese were all still up to par, however, the crust was not perfection as it was previously. It was slightly doughy and there was no crisp at all. I would say that if I were in the area, I would definitely go and pick up a pizza pie and, no doubt, would still enjoy it.

We moved here from NY about 22 years ago and have been going to Broadway Pizza for almost as long.  It is just a "pizzeria" owned by two guys from NY and the food is the closest to what we used to get in NY.  Try the Silician pizza.  We usually order a whole pizza, eat what we want, bring the rest home and freeze it.  Their garlic knots are delicious and they have the best shrimp parmigiana.  The service is great and the servers are very friendly.  It is one of our favorites whenever we want good Italian food.
Hands down the best NY style Pizza in Vegas. Been going there since the early 90's. The owners Mario and Anthony are usually on site.

I am not a pizza fan, but this is absolutely the best pizza in town! Usually I get a pasta dish while everyone else gets a pizza because I am lactose intolerant. The pasta dishes are just ok, nothing really special about them. If you are going to Broadway you should definitely go for the pizza, the pizza makes this place 5 stars. The garlic knots are also my favorite! You get so many garlic knots with your order and yet we never seem to have any left over because they are so addicting! 1-2 is never enough.

I'm not sure how it's even possible that I haven't reviewed Broadway Pizza before now because it is one of my regular haunts. I was even more shocked that I only have 2 Yelp check-ins at Anthony & Mario's place because I've been there at least 3 time this month alone and I'm sure at least 150 times in my life. With all of that said let's get to the pizza.

  Broadway Pizza is exactly the same delicious pie that you will find at the local pizza joints when perusing the streets of New York City. The crust is always the perfect thickness and texture with a great crispiness that only comes from using the best ingredients. The sauce is sweet and well-seasoned; the cheese is plentiful and simply delicious. My wife and I are into the cheese pizza thing lately because the flavor of the pie can't be masked by the overwhelming taste of sausage, onions, or peppers and Broadway doesn't disappoint. We have had occasion to order a more loaded pie when our kids are with us and I can say those pizzas have been delicious as well. 

  The other staple of our trips to Broadway are the garlic knots. For any of you that haven't experienced Broadway Pizza's garlic knots my best description would be; buttery, garlicy, mounds of love!! The knots are made from pizza dough which is rolled out and twisted into what else; knots, and then baked. They are slathered with butter garlic and served hot. They are a treat!!

  Broadway had 2 locations, Rancho at Charleston and West Sahara near Cimarron. Funny thing is the Sahara location seems to do their crust a little differently. The crust at Sahara seems to be a little thicker than at Rancho. It still tastes great but tends to not be as crisp as the Rancho location. Either way Broadway Pizza is a winner if you're looking for a great NY style pie!!

Nothing like a good pizza restaurant that is a strong supporter of the law enforcement community  I love their wall of law enforcement patches, it's neat to look at. Honestly though, I ordered the Rigatoni lunch special and I thought it was not that good at all. So I do not recommend it. But I am still giving them five stars because their Sicilian pizza is TO DIE FOR. The crust has the right amount of crisp, the cheese and sauce are terrific, I love everything about the Sicilian pizza. Their meatball Sicilian is the best by far. Try out the garlic knots also. Definitely homemade and extremely tasty! I've been coming to this place since I was a little girl & will continue coming here for some awesome NY style pizza!

The pizza here is good. My favorite is the broadway special. The broadway special has a mixture of meats and vegetables. The crust is good too and I am generally pretty picky with my crusts. There aren't that many tables here so I got my order to go. I will be returning in the future.

AWESOME place to eat. Visiting from Oregon with my daughters soccer team (players showcase). She's Gluten & Dairy intolerant so pizza places are difficult. 
This is a hole-in-the-wall in all the BEST ways. 
Pizza was great. Service was very friendly. Danyelle Nikhole you rock!!!
Too long of a wait! I called and placed an order and my food wasn't ready at the time they told me it would be ready. They didn't apologize or expedite my order when I did arrive.

This is my neighborhood pizza spot. The staff is always friendly. I really like their fried ravioli (as much as none of us should like something so bad for us, ha). the ranch is perfect with a slice of their pizza, which is a big one for me as it is the only way I eat pizza. Happy to visit this spot!

Best pizza in Las Vegas! We don't live anywhere near here, but we found Broadway a decade ago and have been returning ever since! Their calzones are World Class!!! Not kidding- best ever-! I can't get Pizza this good in NYC, and I try-! Amazing!!
This place was super duper dirty today. Haven't been here in a long time. Forgot how rude the service is -- I guess just like in New York. Also the food made my stomach upset. I would not recommend.

I went on a hunt for the best pizza joint this weekend. This was my third stop. Someone recommended this place to be and I'm glad that I decided to try it. Ample parking. Small little place but just the perfect size. Super friendly staff. We ordered a large cheese pizza and because we checked in on yelp we got 12 free garlic knots. The knots was okay. Nothing too exciting about it. The pizza was thin crust. Just the way I like it. It stays intact throughout the whole meal. A large will feed anywhere from 4 to 5 people. Plenty of leftovers. I will definitely be back

I received my delivery order which was supposed to be half hot half mild. It was half hot half plain. I tried to call so my order could be corrected and no one would answer the phone. Plain is not mild. I want some amout of flavor on my food.

Ok so I'm an east coast transplant who absolutely loves a good slice of pizza. I've tried a few places that claimed to be "New York" style but none of them came close until I came across Broadway Pizza. It's a little slice of heaven that soooo reminds me home. I like to come here pretty often for lunch. Luckily it's a few minutes from my office. Don't come here looking for fancy decor. Not much to look at on the inside. It's a pizza shop. Doesn't try to be anything it's not. The slices are big and the toppings are generous. And the cheese... ah the cheese. It's just right. I can't say how many times I've had pizzas here and the cheese just seems kind of goopy. Also try the garlic knots. They are a must! Even if you aren't in the mood for pizza, you cannot leave there without at least trying one.
Great taste. No skimping on ingredients. Very filling. So glad they were open. Came in at 10pm on a well night. Friendly. Great place

Gumbare! You talkin' to me? Are you talkin' to me? Yeah, this is the real $hit people. NY pizza all the wayyyyyyyy! The entire menu is original, no joke. Don't let the other fools in Vegas fool you. This is the real she-bang. The zeppoles are like love in your tummy, you have to order them and the cannolis. YUM all over the place. :)

A good, solid Pizzeria. Just nothing special. Tried the garlic knots. Nice. Garlicky tasting dough. Tried the White Pizza. Ricotta, garlic and mozzarella. Nice. The taste was very delicate though. Maybe the wife and I were just in the mood for a saltier, greasier, more aggressive/traditional tasting pizza. The service was very good, attentive. We may give Broadway Pizzeria another try if in the area.
I'm not a huge fan of pizza but oh my god... I'm in love!! Their pizza crust is so thin and crunchy. Also, I ordered a dozen wings and they gave me 13! Lol. This place is da bomb!

This place is quite possibly the one of the best pizzas Ive had in Las Vegas. I started going here about five years ago and they haven't lost there touch. They offer thin crust pizza with lots of cheese. The best chicken fingers Ive tasted anywhere and the Knots are a good addition too.
I eat here about once a week & haven't eaten anything bad. Garlic knots, Sicilian pizza, broadway special, wings & Heros. It's all good here! Pick something new & see what happens.

Love Broadway pizza! Since we moved to our house 25 years ago, and found this little place blocks from home, we've never eaten pizza anywhere else. They have jazz music on some weekends. When you walk in the door, you feel like you're in gramma's kitchen...the food is generous, the soup especially is terrific, the Sicilian pizza--to die for! Thanks Anthony and Mario!!

I'm solely basing this review on the foundation of this establishment, "the cheese pizza".  This cheese pizza by far has to be the best tasting cheese pizza I've come across. The combination of their sauce, the spices and ingredaments in the cheese gives this pizza a MOUTHFULL of flavor with every bite. I wouldn't mind putting extra toppings to give it some more pizazz, but I think it would take away from its' flavorful awesomeness. I'm actually waiting to go pick a cheese pizza up with 50 wings. Cripes I'm hungra... 

5 STARS ON THE CHEESE PIZZA YO!!! GREAT SUCCESS!!!

Update: I just finished my portion of the pizza. This place is ALWAYS ON POINT!!!

EYE LIKA CHU PEOPLES!!!

Pizza is so good, and a couple of slices of the fully loaded Broadway special pizza and I'm set. The wings are a whole different experience. They were  overcooked, bland, literally dry, no sauce, a napkin wasn't required, hell, not even a side of sauce was included. They were so bad, it was like chewing on bland, jerky. And for $9.25 hot wings and french fries?? No thank you. I'll pass.

Seriously the best pizza in Vegas! the white pizza is to die for. Get the ranch, and thank me later. Its like magical garlic ranch. The zepollis are the bomb too. Cant say enough about how deelish this place is!
Excellent NY pizza! Even has a Manhattan pizza joint feel to it. Can't go wrong here!
Born and raised in New York! I have to say that this is my favorite spot to grab a large pie, or just a slice

This restaurant was recommended by a friend maybe 10 years ago, and I've probably been there 40 or 50 times since then. It's really good pizza. As close to NY style as I've found in this town. Its small, Maybe 15 or 20 tables/booths. I live more than 10 minutes away, so I order, drive there, pick it up and drive home. It's quicker and cheaper than delivery. I personally recommend the Sicilian pie. It's very good. The crust is as close to NY style Sicilian pizza that I've had in a long time. Whenever I go to pick it up, there's always 2 or 3 people waiting to pick up theirs. The guys making the pizza are friendly. The pizza oven is right in front, which is always a show for the kids. A Sicilian pie feeds 3 people for 3 days. No lie...When somebody asks me about pizza, I tell them that if they like Sicilian they should go here. Excellent.

In Vegas for a soccer tournament. Found this place on resturant.com and glad we did!   It was expense but very good. We ordered the Anthony's and it was good!  Also ordered a meatball sandwich and that too was delish!  Well worth the stop. Too bad there is not one in Cali.

This was the worst experience I have had in a Pizza joint. 2 slices cold in middle, cheese not re melted, pepperoni thrown on in clumps. 
Horrible

I'm no expert on real New York style pizza, but based on what I do know and understand about the style, this place gets it right. I recently decided to try the cheese pizza because that's an obvious benchmark to measure a place like this. It's vastly superior to any of the corporate takeout places you're used to and far beyond comparison with any sort of store bought pizzas such as Digiorno, Kirkland and Red Baron pizza. 

The slices were not overly greasy, and the cheese was not excessive or falling off the edges. I can't remember the last time I had a plain slice of pizza that was so perfect--even the sauce was enjoyable, and not overused. Clearly, the management really is from New York because they seem to have perfected their simple, traditional thin crust pizza. Two slices easily satisfied me during a recent lunch break.

That's not to mention their friendly staff or their tasty deli subs, which I've also tried on a previous occasion. I will have to return to try some of their hot subs and pasta dishes because they have definitely got my attention. If I have another great experience here, I'll have to bump the stars up to 5.
Totally great cheese slice!  Can't beat the price.  Strip center ambience but who cares when the food is this tastey!

Came here with a few co-interns during a quick break from EMR (electronic medical record) training/orientation. We were recommended this place by our instructor for excellent New York-style pizza.

Since were in a rush, we only had time to order their pre-made slices (which they subsequently reheat in the oven). I ordered a slice of cheese pizza with mushrooms. 

The pizza was not bad, but I've had tastier NY pizza (with even crispier crusts, my favorite part). Since I didn't really get a chance to taste much though, I will reserve a more detailed review for when I've tried more off of the menu. 

The service was decent, and the interior has a lot of fun decorations on the wall. Lots of parking in the parking lot.

The worst pizza I've ever had. It makes Totino's taste gourmet.

It was soggy and just tasted terrible. We also got the combo appetizer. With the exception of the fried zucchini, everything was bland and hub says the mozzarella sticks were reheated.

Oh and on the vegetarian pizza I said twice, no peppers. Guess what was all soggy and gross on my pizza? Peppers!

And this place came highly recommended - we stayed with a friend while in Vegas last weekend.
small and jammed with people. But food is why I was there and it was good. its definately New York Style.

One of my favorite pizza joints. I've had pretty much every pizza on the menu but my favorite is the white pizza and plain pepperoni. The ranch dressing is so addicting and those garlic knots are a must.

I stopped by here for lunch and no surprise it was already busy at just after 11 am. This place consistently stays busy, but don't let the long line discourage you because it moves quickly. There is a decent amount of booths and tables with chairs inside and they also have highchairs. 

2 Cheese Slices and Drink ($5.95 lunch special) - The slices are big and the crust is thin yet doesn't flop when picked up. This isn't one of those pizza places that refuses to sell ranch or frowns when someone orders a side of it. Instead they gladly sell a lot of ranch (it's made in-house with garlic powder making it a different and tasty addition to dip your pizza in!) each day and you can get your fix in 2 oz ($0.35), 4 oz ($0.70) or 8 ($1.40) oz sizes. 

Pizza by the Slice - If you just want a single slice it's $2.35 for Neopolitan and $2.40 for Sicilian with an additional $0.40 cents per topping. While I like the regular slices and like to eat them on occasion, it's really the Sicilian pizza ($6.15 for 2 pieces and a drink during the lunch special) that I love to come here for. I have been eating here for many years and the pizza still tastes the same and the specials they have are fairly priced, but it's the Sicilian that keeps me coming back. With the Sicilian pizza it's got a perfectly crisp base and a light and fluffy top with a fair amount of sauce and cheese. If you are a "dipper" like me then don't forget a side of ranch with the Sicilian because it's a must. 

Lunch specials are from 11 am - 3 pm 7 days a week and they have a good variety of options for everyone. Aside from pizza they also have fingers and wings, pasta, hot and cold sandwiches, garlic knots and bread, salad and there are a handful of desert options.
