Currently they have a dine-in and pick-up special where you can get a 16"  cheese pizza for $13.49, but make sure and call them or stop by because their website isn't always up to date with the current specials they have on flyers at the counter where you order.

Used to be a favorite.  Not sure what's changed but service not as good and food ok.  Pizza and chicken wrap.  Mediocre.  To boot there is no public bathroom.   And they say to go to Starbucks that Starbucks will allow their bathrooms to be used. But Starbucks says NO.   How does a restaurant with sit down service not offer bathrooms if any kind??

Only place I will order pizza from. The staff is courtesy, delivery is always on time and the food is delicious. The crust has just they right amount of crispness and the cheese to pepperoni ratio is perfect. If I don't order pizza I order the wings. They are flavorful and not dry .

I have been coming here for their pizza since 2006 and although it is quite a bit of a drive for me, i have to say i think they have the best New York style pizza in the entire city. I have ordered for groups and although they did not always agree that it was the best in the entire city no one has ever not agreed about the pizza being great. I have traveled most of this city trying out the local pizza joints and different pizza styles and i still do occasionally, but i have a few favorites for each style of pizza and this is my number one that i always come back to.
Pizza is really good and the waitress was really nice and very helpful!  I would definitely come and eat there again.  the pizza was fantastic!!!

I've always been a big fan of Broadway. I've been eating pizza and garlic knots here ever since I was a kid. When it comes to ranking the best pizza in town I always bring up their name due to how delicious it is.

Finding a pizza place in Las Vegas isn't hard. Finding one that's good as well as consistent is a different story. Broadway fits that bill and does it good!

I love their food! My favorite place to visit on my cheat days! They are so kind and friendly that it flows into their clientele! I was having an issue with my card one evening and they were more than patient while I tried to get it fixed! Not like many other establishments when you're having card trouble and  they brush you off in out-of-the-way! I greatly appreciate it.

God love 'em. The delivery man waited 20 minutes for me to arrive to pick up my Cannellini soup at the front desk of my condo center. I had ran out of gas, cash, you name it. A woman at the gas station also yelled at me because I was checking out her dog. Strange night. A good night to stay home and eat soup. Anyhow, the delivery man was so cordial, as were all delivery men after him. 

On another occasion, mom needed gluten free grub. Broadway was not 100% sure that the stock they used was gluten free, so they delivered the soup with the can so that we could evaluate the ingredients to assure ourselves. I felt that was really above and beyond because my mom never believes people when they say their food's gluten free. She likes to see proof.

Broadway Pizza truly gets customer service. 

As for the food, I ordered the Cannellini soup several times even after I wasn't sick anymore. Big containers delivered every couple of weeks. The soup comes with a ton of garlic knots too, which are especially good when fresh and hot, but I don't mind eating 2 or 6 straight out of the fridge later on.

Never been inside. Never had the pizza.
I love this  place .....been eating here a long time the pizza is awesome the staff is friendly and the good thing for me I only  live a mile away...but if I didn't I would drive across town for it!!
This place is outstanding.  For is great.  People are even better.   After the horrible treatment from Boston pizza this place is the place to go to be treated right.  They respect you.

This place is across my my hospital so its a convenient as well as good.

So the pizza is good stuff...pretty close to NY pizza in Vegas..not a home run but it's pretty good. One off my favs is pepperoni and fresh garlic..mmmmmm.  The garlic knots are pretty damn good..especially the stuffed ones....

I like the calzones here as well...heart and loaded with goodness and without that cheap ass doughy taste you get from some pizza joints.

Shrimp primivera.....was bomb as well..a surprise from a place like this. Large in portions and very moist. Not the usual chewy over done deals you get sometimes.  

The salads are to the point but nothing stellar but they are always cold crisp and fresh. My only complaint is the ranch...I like that good cold thick ranch but theirs is a little runny and has a different taste for sure. It also makes me enjoy their wings a little less.

Good spot..if you;re in the area try it out.

I was born and raised in Brooklyn so I'm gonna keep it real!...i recently moved here to Vegas and I've been searching for a decent slice of pizza high and low, and I have to admit this place comes pretty close.

I met one of the owners Anthony, a really nice guy and when he told me he's from Long Island I appreciated his food even More, because only a true New Yorker knows what true Italian Food is suppose to taste like!

Now on to the food...the pizza is good, flavor taste like NY but the size of it is not true to the real size of a NYC pie. Their Chicken parm Sub really hit home for me, their Philly cheese steak sub is my "go to" item....the only thing that truely broke my heart are their zeppoles smh...A true zeppole is suppose to be light, fluffy and slightly greesey lol their zeppoles tasted like their pizza dough just fried up and drizzled with powdered sugar. No bueno! lol...Another thing that bothered me was their Garlic Knots, Don't go cheap on your garlic knots and sprinkle garlic powder over them, that is soo disrespectful....Garlic knots are  little balls of love! U gotta chop up fresh garlic and olive oil to put on those bad boys Anthony...it kills me- because u know this! 

I wish this place had rice balls!  man I miss a good rice ball! I have yet to try their cannolis, I hope it Doesn't taste generic or store bought. That's next on my list to try....Anothny told me to try their pasta dishes..but I'm extremely skeptical about my pasta. My standards are way to high for Vegas, so I hope u bring it Broadway! Lmaooo

Overall I'm definitely going to be a regular at this place from now on. Nothing makes me feel more secure about my Food than knowing a true New Yorker made it! If u are from the East Coast you know that first impressions mean a lot, Anthony the owner was very kind, he made me feel at home, and he took constructed criticism like a champ!.... You can tell that he really cares about his establishment and I respect it!

Keep doing your thing Broadway!

Once a month or so, Yahoo rates "the best of ___" in various cities across America. I am reading  the best pizza joints in cities and I see Anthony & Mario's listed as the best place in Las Vegas. 
I think wow !! I can't wait to try it out, so on my last visit to the city I travel up Charleston Blvd. past the Palace Station ( pre O J ) and find the pizzeria tucked away in a small strip mall. A small little pizza shop selling pizza by the slice is not exactly what I envisioned as what the "best pizza in Vegas," was going to look like. Yes, I expected something gaudy and pretentious like in the rest of the city. 
Their menu is varied and we tried a calzone - very nice; and a few pieces of pizza by the slice. 
The nice thing about A&M's is that for a modest price they will enhance your basic slice of cheese pizza with the toppings of your choice.  When my hamburger mushroom and black olive masterpiece arrived at the table, it was loaded or virtually smothered in toppings. 
The pizza was excellent. What more can you say. 

The atmosphere is what you would expect from a pizza front selling pizza by the slice - it might even remind you of "New York". The staff is very friendly and helpful and they helped make the experience much better than my initial impression after such a huge build up on Yahoo - but then again, it might just be Yahoo .........
If you are in the need for a couple of large pieces of pizza, done to your style, then this is the place for you. It just might take you some time to find it.

Service was excellent. The place reminded me of pizzerias on long island (where I'm from). Being from NY is a gift and a curse being that I can't find good pizza most of the time. 

For like 20 bucks (thank you yelp check in deal) we fed our family of 5. That right there is pretty sweet. 
The garlic knots were a little harder and dryer than liked, but my kids still liked them.they brought them out before the pizza which I appreciate. 

We got half pep have cheese. Perfect amount of grease, cheese didn't slide right off (hate that). It was really delicious. 

Will definitely return when in Vegas.

The first time my love took me to Broadway I instantly fell in love at first bite. The pizza was amazing. For a second I forgot I was in Las Vegas,  that first bite reminded me of the NY style pizza I had in little Italy in New York a few years prior. I never thought I would find a pizza that good any where, but I did and in Las Vegas!  But its not just the pizza the wings, chicken fingers, eggplant parm, chicken parm, the pasta and the garlic knots are all wonderfully delicious. ( Yes I have been there more than once! ) Last night I had fried dough covered in powdered sugar , I was covered but I didn't care because I enjoyed every yummy bite!

Okay some of the best pizza since I left the east coast 25 years ago! Sicilian pie was awesome- crispy bottom crust, generous toppings and you can bring in your own wine ore beer.  Homemade soup, baked ziti was good too. Only negative was the gay NY giants banner! :)

My Girl met her best friend here over 2 years ago when she asked if she could try one of her Garlic Knots, and so this place holds a special in her heart. 

They have a great two slice and a drink special for just under $6 bucks and they are HUGE slices. Two of those for a friend and yourself along with some garlic knots and it is a "make your tummy dance the happy dance" kind of meal for under $15

The place is busy around lunchtime with many people going in and out and it is easy to see why, the foods just good.

Be sure to give this place a try!

I'm from Jersey, This pizza is just like the pizza you get in jersey, it's the best out here in the land of the dummies. So many places out here claim to be New York Style Pizza, this is the only one who should say that, it's the best, worth the drive from any part of town.

Best pizza & wings in town! I'm also addicted to their chicken Caesar salad. I know, who goes to a pizza joint for salad? But seriously, I crave it 24/7!!  My boyfriend & his family are from the east coast & got me hooked on this place! You're treated like family when you're there & I love seeing the same amazing servers & cooks there every time we go!

Great N.Y. Pizza!  A full Italian menu.  Food is great & the garlic knots are yummy.  It's very reasonable price for all the food you get.  This little place is located in the Smith's shopping Center on Rancho near W. Charleston.  Delivery or eat in.

I've had the calzone, garlic knots, and the gluten free meatball pizza .... damn soooooo bomb! Garlic knots I thought were okay not enough garlic for knots but other than that everything else was so delicious. Perfect size for two people the gluten free pizza and the calzone is huge ! I loved it all !!

We used to love this place since its the closest thing you can get from pizza in New York. Sadly the service is horrible. We've been seated for 20 minutes and no one had taken our order.   The family that came 15 minutes after us were taken care of, drinks, table settings were served first since they knew the servers. That is not customer service at all!!!  Never going back.

As a transplanted New Yorker, I was starved for good pizza for years after moving to Vegas. There is some pretty bad pizza here. Over the years I managed to find a couple that weren't too bad. Then one day about 10 yrs ago at work they ordered pizza delivery. I couldn't believe how good it was! Broadway Pizza has great Neapolitan pizza. It is one of the few places that even make Sicilian & It is just what I crave! The Eggplant parm is overstuffed & the best around! The prices are very reasonable!

Normally we wouldn't spend $40 on pizza...but seeing as the wife and I were still drunk and hungover from our New Years Eve we decided to make an exception. 7 months later and we still talk about this place whenever we have pizza here in Arizona. The delivery charge was $6 plus a $6 tip so the $40 would really have been $28 for a large pizza, mozzarella sticks, bread, and a 6 pack of soda. Really great price and value, even at $40 I felt like we got our moneys worth and more. can't wait to get back to LV in July.

This is definitely a favorite spot.  Typically we order the bucket of wing/large pizza combo.  Never disappoints.
Love love LOVE the sicilian marinara...if you're looking for an amazing pizza with a nice thick crust and loaded with lots of tomatoes and garlic on top, try this!
The zeppole are awesome, too.  Can't eat just one!!

The pizza is just ok at its best, and the wings, though small, are decent.  There's lots of really good pizza in Vegas and Broadway doesn't quite make the cut but it's close to home and offers take out or delivery, service is pretty good.
Hawaiian Pizza, Good Cheese Pizza, Cannoli's, Yummy Food Good price me and my coworkers love to order from here!

Can I say OMG..
The food is fabulous.. especially the garlic knots with ranch. The server Shannon is absolutely the BEST one I've ever had. We had a large party of 12 and she served us our wings person by person and our pizza slices. Even came back and said "Anyone ready for a second slice". I have to say I've never had this kind of love and been blessed by such a sweet lady as Shannon.. she needs to be commended. Please give her a raise!! 
Thanks Shannon!!

Got knots?  Garlic knots that is.  4 carb-filled stars!

Yeah, I'm a hefty guy and I'm supposed to be watching my diet.  But man, pizza is one of my weak points.  Be it the variety of pizzas to be had of America's #1 top money-making foods, or the fact that I survived off of this and hand-me-down Burger King leftovers during my collegiate years...pizza just holds dear to my heart.

Broadway Pizzeria ain't your fancy, California-inspired, artisan, renaissance, froo-froo metrosexual pizza.  They do what they do fast...they from New York baby!  Just check out the NY-inspired mural on their wall!  No kissin' your A$$ while talking to you about your portfolio and pouring you a glass of the new merlot from their family winery.  Get in, sit down, get a menu, get your order in, eat your pie, and go!  This place is popular for the quick lunch crowd!  

They do Italian, and they do a good job at it.  You got your NY style pizza (I love me that thin, crispy crust), they do the thicker Sicilian style pizza, they got salads, fingers and wings, Italian specialties, hot subs, cold subs, calzones, and desserts.  But dammit, get the GARLIC KNOTS!  One of the house specialties.  Great when they're hot and fresh with a side of marinara.

But always, always get a slice of pie at Broadway!  It's good stuff!  Get yourself their pick-up special, a large 16" cheese pizza for $11.99.  Sure it sounds a bit plain, but if you have a foundation of a cheese pizza that tastes like crap (Pizza Hut...I choose you!) then how can adding toppings make it any better?  Broadway's cheese pizza is bomb diggity delicious!  Good crust with fresh sauce and good quality cheese.  Very tasty.  Go ahead and add a topping or two for a tiny additional cost.  I love mine with fresh mushrooms and either their sliced sausage or pepperoni.  Top mine with some grated parmesan, garlic and red pepper flakes, and a nice cold beer?  I'm good, seriously.  In my opinion, best NY pizza you can have here in LV...and yeah, I've had NY pizza from NY!

This place is usually upbeat, especially during lunch rush.  Eat in if they have the space, or get a fast lunch to go for take out.  Service is quick and friendly.  They have a ton of daily lunch specials to choose from.  And the prices are on the cheap!  Don't be discouraged about any of the shouting, that's how some of the New Yorkers talk!  Fughettaboutit!

This is by far the best pizza I've had in Vegas. It is thin New York style with a crust that is to die for. The toppings are so tasty & flavorful. I love that this pizza is not greasy or heavy but just perfect. Whatever it's cheat day I always make sure to order a Broadway special with extra mushrooms. Drink some Moscow mules & watch some trash TV. It's my guilty pleasure and I'm so grateful that this pizza joint makes such mouth-gasmic pizza!!!!

By far the best place for lunch during the week I frequent here, since I work in the area. One can call in an order and pick it up. The lunch specials that Broadway has are great and a good value. The atmosphere of the restaurant is like being transported to a NY style pizza joint.
Best pizza in Vegas! I'm a North Jersey girl living here in Vegas, and this is the real deal!!! Love everything about this place!

If you want to start a place you will be addicted to, this is it. A Calzone is marvelous. We have tried many things, Ravioli, Lasagna, and they have quart size Italian Ice..... Soo delicious. Chicken Parmigiana with Ziti (I love) or you can have it with spaghetti.  Garlic knots and /or garlic bread. VERY FRESH salads. Cannoli's, and Tiramisu cake, It is like walking into downtown NY. The wall are all painted with the NY scenes. They are the best and they deliver. Love you all...Janelle.

Good old fashion pizza, the way it should be. This isn't a place for all the "bacon stuffed mac & cheese crust" gimmicky crap they are peddling at the bigger places. Just simple pizza that is made right with good ingredients..... what a concept!

Really good pizza, I love coming here with my hubby the food is great and the staff is even better everyone is friendly and customer service is on point. The gals taking your order are always nice and I love that about this place. The pizza slices are huge and so very very tasty. Today I'm having the calzone I'll update my review and let you know how it tastes. I'm assuming it will be amazing as is everything else here.

It is difficult to review a place that I have never dined in at and have only ordered one menu item from.  I have only ordered food to go.  I will give it four stars based on the consistent high quality food.  I have only ordered the eggplant parm sandwich from here.  This is by far my favorite place to get such a sandwich.  It is loaded with tender fried eggplant, smothered with a generous serving of marninara sauce and topped with what seems to be a half a brick of cheese.  The flavor is unsurpassed.  The bread is is always tough enough to hold up to the sauce yet not so tough you can't eat it.  There is so much more than that on the menu that I would like to try but haven't yet.  They have specialty pizza's with white sauce.  They have the other sandwiches, of course.  And their own claim to fame, garlic knots.  I want it all.  If there is anything to complain about when it comes to Broadway Pizzeria, it is that their service is on the slow side.  This, however, is offset by the reason behind the slow service.  It is always busy.  That says a lot for a busniess when the line is out the door.  It proves this is some place worth checking out.  Be warned though, parking is sparse in this shopping center.  You may drive around a bit or have to walk a while to get in.  Don't let that scare you away, though.

Really enjoy having pizza here!  It feels like a true pizzeria!  Their garlic knots are to die for!  My husband and I went to Springs Preserve to a beer tasting.  All of the vendors had insane lines for food.  Good for them, bad for us!  After we left, this was the closest pizzeria I could think of.  I used to work near here and would frequent it.  I forgot how good it was!  My husband was impressed such a good pizza shop was in such an obscure strip mall/grocery store complex.  They have really good combos and reasonable prices.  It's not on our side of town but I'm sure we'll have to make a point of going back!  

Do not forget an order of the garlic knots!!!!

My family comes straight out of Brooklyn. This is the only place we will get pizza from. Delicious sauce, crispy crust, and amazing cheesy goodness!
The garlic knots are no joke either. I have hooked many friends on this place on the knots alone! Seriously best pizza I have ever had in Vegas, worth any trip. 
But, on a side note, if you take the pizza home, I would suggest popping the pizza back in the oven for a couple minutes :)
Stay away from the sicilian unless your want a pound of bread...
Vegetarian pizza is outstanding!   Also the Italian sausage pasta with penned pasta is so good!  Always have a great experience gere!

I'm glad I waited to give this place a review because about 8 months ago I would have given them 1 star. The reason was because the girl at the counter was beyond rude and didn't seem to know how to deal with the general public.

This time around it was quiet different and I'm glad I gave BP another chance. I only wished I would have given them that second chance a little sooner.

This time around the pizza tasted much better and I guess you can't go wrong with $2.16 a slice. Also everyone working there this time around was super friendly and attentive and almost every employee in sight greeted the customers walking in.

I'd say this second visit really did feel like a family restaurant, which was awesome to experience and I'll make sure to make it back here again.
best pizza in vegas.  the knots were great.Been eating here for 15 years. Never been disappointed.
Great place, staff is super friendly and very nice. Food is delicious and large portions. My regular pizza place, worth every penny.

Excellent. Now that's what I'm talking about when it comes to NY style pizza. Nice, thin crust and not too much dough. Easily folded if that is how you like to eat your slice. 
Not too heavy on the cheese. This made the tangy, flavorful sauce just that much better. The cheese was like molten lava, and I was so anxious to take a bite that I burned the top of my mouth. When will I ever learn. This pizza was worth it though.

Located in the busy strip shopping center at Smith's location at Rancho and Charleston. Been on the "Best of Las Vegas" list for years.

We used a restaurant certificate (only 1 certificate per month can be used BTW, not just here, that's every restaurant policy that participates in the program) (our certificate was a $20 minimum purchase) for take-out. I'm not sure if you can use a certificate in conjunction with the takeout special ($12.99 large cheese pizza). Got the large white pizza (there are two different kinds of white pizzas) and the stuffed garlic knots. Pretty good sized menu- had appetizers, sub sandwiches, and salads in addition to the pizza. Hubby said there was a good amount of people there dining in. 

This was the first time we got some food here, but not the first time we had the pizza, as my MIL gave us some pizza from here a while back; which we thought was really good, and that was left over! The thin sliced pizza is yummy. Very satisfying. I don't have white pizza often. 

Mmm, white pizza!!! Mmm, stuffed garlic knots!!! 

Good thing we had someone else over, so the large pizza was good for the three of us, and we still had a couple slices to eat the next day (and one knot). The stuffed garlic knots (pepperoni and cheese- note: doesn't specify on the menu) were so good. Comes with marinara sauce. Our friend kept burping up the garlic, but it wasn't unpleasant, like if I had portuguese sausage (I can't have that anymore, burping for 15 hours is unbearable). The funny thing is that the next morning, the car still smelled like garlic! And same with the house, too. Good thing both of us had garlic breath because it's bad when just one of us has garlic. 

Anyway, we will be back, and we have another certificate to use, too, woot-woot!

This is a little gem in the world of pizza. It is tucked away in a strip mall near a Dotty's and a Roberto's. I was referred to by a friend who said they have some of the best calzones in Vegas. This friend is a long time Vegas resident, so we had every reason to believe him. 

We had a veggie calzone and small white pizza with an order of garlic knots. They are apparently famous for the garlic knots, and we were not disappointed. Very fresh, with a strong (but not over powering) real garlic flavor. Noting the deliciousness of the knots, it is no surprise that the crust on the calzone and pizza are the highlights. It is not too thin, full of flavor and not soggy. 
The ingredients on both the pizza and the calzone seemed fresh, and were also full of flavor. 

The place was hopping for a Thursday night, and the service was friendly and very quick. 

One of the better NY style pizza places in Vegas!
Been coming here for years and still hands down the best pizza in town. I rather eat dirt cause that's what other pizza taste like if it's not broadway pizza
I LOVE the Chicken Pasta Soup! Anytime I feel under the weather it is my go to and it always delivers.
Been coming here for over 15 year's love there food and prices, recommend linguini with white clam sauce is to die for, pepperoni rolls Amazing and you can never go wrong with Garlic Knots.

Several people said Broadway Pizzeria makes the best pizza in Vegas.  It was good, but Metro Pizza is much better.  The pizza appeared homemade.  I assume it is nostalgic for the New York folks.  The seating was limited.  It seemed a bit pricey for what you are getting.  The parking was horrible.  I'll go again, but please stop trying to convince me that it is the best.

I'm very disappointed with this place.  It doesn't have a great taste.  I'm really upset that I brought a coupon for half price in and the girl over the counter tried to overcharge me.  When I asked for a breakdown, she said "Well its $16 plus tax, that makes it $19, then with the coupon, its 9.50 PLUS TAX.  ????  I looked at her and I guess she read my face because she reached in her register  and gave me my correct change.

Breakdown of Broadway Pizzeria: 

FOOD: 
Broadway Special (Pepperoni, Green Peppers, Mushrooms, Sausage, Meatballs - omitted the olives and onions) - The pizza wasnt bad but it wasnt authentic NYC Pizza.  The crust could have been been a little bit more crisp but I think what it really was the topping.  It need that cheesey gooey-ness that normally eat when you take a bit and have that cheese string still connected to the slice... and that didnt happen.

SERVICE:
The staff was really friendly and always made a point to check with us to make sure we had everything we needed.  I did think it was odd that each table had the pizza stand but when we got our pizza they didnt use it - they used instead the folding tray stand which made it awkward for the third person in our group to get the food since it was furthest from him.

Nice cheap slices of pizza.  I got a slice of pep, mush, and sausage.  It was exactly what I was looking for.  Give them a try.  Thin NY style pizza.

They also had other items like wings, sandwiches, etc. (see their menu).

I would go back if I was in the area.

This is pretty short, but I don't know what else to say...

i ordered for delivery a Baked Ziti,with marinara sauce, 10 garlic knots and a side salad-plus a drink all for under $11, ($10 minumum) they had it to me within 20 minutes and it was hot & tasty. way too much food for any one person to consume. The delivery guy was nice & friendly.

I have ordered the pizza from here before both the sicilian style and their Broadway special-they use sliced sausage,pepperoni and meatballs. The pizza is great NY style but I prefer the traditional over the sicilian. Calzones are always a winner and philly cheese steak sandwiches have been fairly good too.

The girls wanted to eat pizza and this was the nearest pizza place close to where we were.  I never do reviews just because quite honestly I get lazy to write one. This is my first time doing a review because I felt compelled to do it based on our experience eating here. First off, to be fair, I DON'T EAT PIZZA! My hunny and the girls love pizza and they don't just settle for anything. With that being said, here's our review: Customer service is on point 100%. I was able to bring my green curry inside and eat it here with no problem (remember, I don't eat pizza) and they kept coming to us asking if we needed refills on our drinks, and asked if we are ok at least three times while we were waiting for the pizza.  They even served the pizza on their plates rather then us serving it ourselves. Hunny and I looked at each other and said,  man, they have GREAT customer service. That makes a huge difference...now the food - They ordered wings and a plain cheese pizza. They report that the wings are good. The pizza was great, with lots of flavor. I know they just ordered cheese but you can still mess up a cheese pizza. They loved it!

The food is good, service is fine , but the way the owner treats his employees makes it so uncomfortable, dont think I will ever go back.  To bad, we really enjoyed our neighborhood pizza place.  But when I saw one of the owners berate his poor employee in front of customers, well I felt like if I gave them anymore of my money, I would be condoning this behavior.  It is sad because the poor girl probably needs the job so bad she is willing to take the abuse.  It would be great if the all walked off the job and watch the owner try and do it himself.
great place for pizza.i always get 2 slices for around $5.nice thin and crispy crust with a light sause,just the way i like it.they have table service and delivery(even to my downtown hotel)

Good pizza moderately priced with lots of specials available. Been here several times with a cousin and service has always been nice and refills quick. Ordered a Meat lovers pizza, a 16" covered in sausage, meatballs and pepperoni ($17). A nice family style restaurant with a bunch of NYC memorabilia in a strip mall with a Smith's supermarket.

Broadway Pizzeria has the best Pizza in Nevada period, i kid you not, and it doesnt stop there, everything on their menu is good, the salads the philli steaks the pastas and all that.  Its a small place so its always crowded especially around lunch time.  You can never go wrong with Broadway Pizzeria.  Yup

I love this place. I have been coming here for lunch for a while and I forgot how good the food is, try the garlic knots! How reasonably priced it is and how gosh darn crowded it gets at lunch so go early!!!

Discovered this place recently by mistake.  OMG.  It's so darn good.  They make a veal parmagiana sub.  That's so old school!  The thing is stuffed with lightly breaded veal, a hunk of mozzarella, and oozing sweet garlic tomato sauce.  I'm addicted to my veal parm sub and a plain cheese slice.  The plain slice is all you need to give everything else on the menu a try.  So delicious.  I need to stay away from this place or I'll be huge in no time.  Nice people work there too.

Pizza is garbage I went there years ago and it was phenomenal I went there tonight sat in the booth for 10 minutes before the waiter came over I had to go to the counter to order I look and they got a huge piece of dough they pull out of the freezer pizza was horrible overpriced pass this place up go to Rosati's best pizza in Nevada..... Very disappointed overpriced crap I'm from Chicago I know Pizza you guys suck

Great prices, great pizza and the staff is so friendly which to me is everything! I'll definitely be back, it's rare these days to find people who actually care about how your experience was and they do!

In one word? Disappointing.

After a very late night, I awoke with a mean hangover and a hankering for some wings.  After coming to an agreement that we were in no shape to leave our apartment, we decided delivery was the only way to go.  

I searched out some delivery options (on Yelp, of course), and decided on pizza and wings from Broadway. ...Mistake number one... I found a special on their website and when I called to order it, the prices were listed wrong - it was actually more expensive than what was listed, but we were starving and needed sustenance, so I ordered anyway.

The food arrived in a timely manner, the delivery guy was super nice, and we were ready to dig in.  Unfortunately, what we dug into was not what we'd hoped for.  The wings were dry, overcooked, and the sauce wasn't very spicy (considering we ordered the hot wings).  The pizza crust was super bland and dry, and the cheese was nothing to write home about either.  For someone who avoids gluten and dairy 90% of the time, when I break those rules, it had better be for some mind-blowing New York style pizza, which this was definitely not.  

My recommendation? If you want amazing wings, go to Twin Peaks.  Great pizza? Go to Secret Pizza.  

(2 stars for the nice delivery guy and fast service)

Best pizza in Las Vegas. I literally don't care to eat pizza from any other spot. 
I live on the opposite side of town and I will make the trip just to pick up a pizza.
10/10

Want a TRUE NY style pizza? Come here... best thing in town. Love this place and the people.  Great service, affordable food and their ranch dressing is the best thing ever.  I wish we lived closer but they deliver pretty much anywhere in town.  

Love you Broadway!!!!

Went on a sunday and decided to dine in. The ladies are friendly but sort of appeared uninterested in serving us. Anywho, we opted for 3 slices of pepperoni pizza,  some fries and mild wings. The crust was a wonderful crunchy texture , but I was unimpressed by the cheap stiff pepperoni.  The cheese and sauce were good tho.
 The wings were pretty spicy for it to be called " mild " , the fries and ranch were good.  The ambiance was "meh" it was cool for a quick lunch. But nothing I'd drive back for.

I ordered a large buffalo chicken pizza...it tasted like I thought it should lol...it was great! The restaurant itself is like a small pizzeria.  The girl working the counter was very courteous! I would definitely go back and try something else when I'm on a lunch break and feeling like pizza.
This is the best Italian food in Vegas. Everything the pizza ,baked ziti , salads. Is amazing. We have been going here for years. So frickin good.

Best Wings in town. Pasta portions are huge and come with delicious garlic knots. 

Great service always!

We found this pizzeria the day we moved here via Yelp, and I'm glad we did! After a long week of packing, moving, and unpacking-  being in an unfamiliar city, we wanted a quick bite to eat. We stumbled in, ordered, and got our food to go within about 15 minutes. The staff was extremely nice and enthusiastic, and the food was great. Give them a try!

Memories Worth Returning To...

Nearly twenty-two years later and  Broadway Pizzeria is still serving those same gigantic, great tasting individual slices I remember eating as an adolescent.

Stopped by during an unexpected detour home yesterday and purchased slice of cheesy deliciousness for nearly two bucks. Don't forget the ranch; you'll thank me later!

11/08/2014.. very happy to return to this place again... after surgery... I forgot to request "extra sauce" on my pie... F'ed up from anesthesia.. but my taste buds were not... I ordered the pie with pepperoni and it really came out nicely toasted and tastey.. I didn't need to order "extra sauce" because the guy who made our pizza knew what he was doing...... really good thin crust , tastey pie... and I'm from Long Island, where all we used to do was eat pizza and chinese food for fun... I will be back when ever I am in their neighborhood... just wish they had fresh crushed garlic to put on their pie with the pepperoni while it cooked ...but hey... this place puts out a very nice pepperoni pie! I don't know about other dishes but all the other people around me with chicken fingers, pasta, etc seemed very pleased.. this place comes off as a nice Mom and Pop Pizza place...

Just around the corner from UMC hospital. Real NewYork style family owned and operated Italian small place. 
There menu has something for everyone. 
If you can't find it here you are in a laundromat. Service is super fast. Everything we ordered was perfect. I had the lasagna which came with too large of a excellent salad and garlic knots. Just a tad too spicy and the garlic is not my friend. However that being said I highly recommend this authentic New York style restaurant.

WHOO HOO to the pizza. Booooooo to the rest of my order. We called in the order and they said it would take 20 minutes so knowing this we decided to leave right away so the fries that came with my hot wings would be hot and fresh. I can't stand cold fries and It's not their fault if I'm late for it right? So we chilled in the dining room. Everyone around us were really enjoying their food. The table adjacent to us got their Sicilian pizza and it looked absolutely amazing I will be getting that next time! I was green with envy! 

We didn't wait long came out just in time. Also got the fried zucchini which was piping hot. The breading was good just need some seasoning in the batter but still enjoyable. 

My only issue was the wings and fries. Way to send me back to middle school cafeteria days. In the car opened The box. The fries were wilted and  cold, no salt and the wings barely had any sauce. Very disappointing. 

The pizza was the best thing so I can't complain too much.
Everything was excellent! Pizza, pasta, wings, garlic knots and the Ranch! Definitely a keeper and our new go-to place for pizza and wings!
Pizza was good and greasy NY style pizza. Garlic knots are really good. We also ordered wings and liked them. The ranch is awesome. Service is friendly and excellent. Will be back!

I've been going to Broadway since I was a very young child, and I couldn't have been any luckier to be exposed to the best pizza in Las Vegas so soon into my life. Everyone who works there is incredibly nice, and super personable. Plus, you can't beat the food. The pizza is delicious and authentic. And everything else on the menu is always a good choice. Not once in my life have I been disappointed. If you're eating in, the atmosphere is really great and there is nothing better than watching someone toss the dough for your pizza, and if you're getting it delivered it is always guaranteed that your delivery person will be amazing (and probably eventually know who you are if you order from them often enough). 

Get their garlic knots and try their ranch dressing-- they are top notch and you will not regret it!

Great atmosphere.  Their portions are great for sharing.  Went with a group of friends shared several appetizers. Food taste and amount were outstanding. Garlic knots, salads, fried ravioli and pizza were teriffic.

This place is a little far from my house, maybe a 15 minute drive, but if you like Sicilian pizza, I don't think you can find a better place in Las Vegas.
I live in the east for a while, and I would rank this place's Sicilian pie right up there with pizza places in the east.
The place is small, but accommodating nonetheless.
The staff is extremely friendly (my wife is always accusing the girls of flirting with me, so I can only pick-up their pizza and not stay there to eat it.
They offer drinks in there that you don't normally see in any eatery (e.g. Yoohoo, Sobe, etc.) which I think is neat.
And, considering that I just now paid $20 for a Sicilian pie, that will probably make four meals for my wife and I, it seems reasonably priced.
I don't know how much more I can say. Go there and see for yourself.
Great change from all the chain pizza places. Great pizza and garlic knots! Fast and friendly. We got pepperoni, sausage pizza. It isn't typical pizza sausage that you think of. Was delicious

Been here about 6 times in the last year. It started out great. One of the best slices of pizza I could find in Las Vegas. But unfortunately it seems to have gone downhill in only a year. Each time getting worse and worse. This last time will be the last time I come here. I had two soggy disgusting cold slices. The waitress was nice but the shady people working in the kitchen pretty much sealed the deal that I will not be returning.

Broadway Pizzeria..is the best Pizzeria in Las Vegas..period!  I dont care about the size of the restaurant...yadayadayada!  Service is prompt with a smile..the real deal New York style pizza..garlic knots to die for..calzones..subs..salads..pasta..their sauce is ..well I have no words to describe how out of the park perfect..It Is..Ive had so so New York style in town..but either too greasy..or flavor is bland..etc. this pizza is "On Point Perfect?  Theres an italian scent in the air..wow!  Incomparable...

Whatever you do, don't order for delivery. We waited 1.5 hours for the pizza we ordered.  When I called back to ask why it was taking so long, they had three excuses why they didn't make the pizza order. They claimed the card was wrong, claimed they tried to call, but couldn't provide the number they had "personally called several times", finally, the boss had left and locked my order in his office.  Yelp has let me down with a garbage recommendation
Best pizza in Las Vegas, service is great ,place is clean and a goof location, have been here many times and will return many more.

Yes, their pizza is good. But where they lack is in customer service. Here's my issue:

On their website right now, it states that they are offering their large Upstate White pizza for the same price as a medium (see photo attached). Cool, so I called and ordered it as take out. And when I came to pick it up and asked them about the special, they would not honor the price. ....Huh? IT SAYS IT RIGHT THERE ON YOUR WEBSITE! I even showed it to the cashier who took my phone and showed it to the owner (who by the way, was sitting in the back stuffing his face- how professional). The owner didn't even bother to get up to come talk to me and instead I saw him just shrug and mutter something while chewing. And when the cashier came back to me he simply said, "Oh, prices change." Well, one of my biggest pet peeves is when people don't follow through with their word. Like what is the point of offering that special if you don't even honor it?? Or if it's wrong, don't just shrug like it's whatever and fix it!

Probably won't be back just because of this issue. There are plenty of other good pizza places in Vegas.

I really enjoyed this place. Decorated in New York themed walls this pizzeria has a great feel to it. Order at the counter and they bring you your order or you can order to go. Had the lunch special 2 slices and a drink for roughly 6$ pizza was tasty with classic NY thin style. I've heard the knots are quite good and will have to go back sometime for them. The bagel place next door is also a good place to stop
Literally the BEST pizza in town. Service is amazing, pizza is awesome!!! Pepperoni and sausage is the best!!!
Broadway makes a solid, legit New York slice. I'm actually a huge fan of their Sicilian pizza too.
Regular pie is average but who cares because the Sicilian (square pie) pizza is one of the best pizzas in Las Vegas.
Above average pizza, friendly service,decent price. I did enjoy garlic knots .I would call this a why not pizza.

Lunch time.......work close by..choice between port a sub and broadway pizza....I made the RIGHT CHOICe. Lots of pizza joints in town. Big name and mom/pop. Have lived here for 7yrs, before in Jersey for 13. This is as good as it can get for NY style pizza...all I can say is WOW!! Perfect crust, perfect sauce..went simple  slice pepperoni, olives/mushrooms. This was fantastic..pepperoni not greasy. Cooked up perfect. You order what and how much you want. If you want to eat pizza as it was originally designed by God this is the place to go. BTW they have a huge menu, so if pizza is not your thing, have no doubt you'll find whatever else you might crave. Enjoy...................
Awesome! They have great lunch specials, and the slices are really big. Great value, and delicious!

Great pizza.  My wife ordered the gluten free pizza which comes in one size and was surprisingly large for a personal size pizza. It tastes great.  The Sicilian pizza tastes great and is a deep dish pizza. They also have a great lunch deal for 2 slices and a drink. The slices are cheese but you can add a topping for only 40 cents.

Super nice people and plenty of parking outside. Pizza tastes good and the chicken wings are pretty good as well. We went with a big group but they were still able to accommodate us and be courteous. Try this place out u will like it!

I've tried some decent pizza here in Vegas, but honestly, most of it is ok. Ok means not great. We tried Broadway after a trip to the Smith's next door. The Broadway Special is just that, special; and probably the best value on the menu. Last night, we tried the Broadway Special Sicilian. As someone that is not normally a fan of thick crust pizzas, or the extra wait to get them, all I can say is wow. This crust has all the marks of a fine quality bread, Slightly crunchy on the outside, slightly chewy on the inside.
I have tried the calzone, and it was good; but I keep coming back to the pizza.
My wife has tried both the soups, and even if they are a touch on expensive side, we keep getting them because she keeps raving about them.
Many people here have raved about the garlic knots. Let's agree to disagree. We've had them where they tasted decent exactly once out of close to a dozen orders. So we have dubbed them Garlic nots- they come free with dinner or soup, you get what you pay for.
We have ordered the chicken wings once and they were not pleasant at all. They were over cooked, dry, and generally inedible.

Having said that, this is a Pizza place and one of the best Pizza's at the best price you will find in the Vegas area. 

They do deliver, but depending on the neighborhood you live in, may not accept credit/debit cards. Pick up is much faster than delivery. 

The people inside are incredibly friendly and attentive to everyone who walks through the door.

Amazing and kind staff. Affordable price for extremely delicious food. Our first time there, I brought my cousin from Australia, her friend, and my little Sister. We ordered a whole lot of food. Pizza was divine, garlic knots, wings,fries and chicken finger. All GIANT portions under $60 for enough food to feed 6+ people. Affordable but great quality and flavor. I must visit this place anytime I go to Vegas now. Thank you for existing. I wish you were in L.A. so that I could visit you every week!
Love this place, originally we r New Yorkers who are now Vegas locals . When we crave N Y pizza this is our go to.

Have you ever been to Attilio's Pizza?

Chances are, you haven't.

Attilio's Pizza is this little strip mall storefront next to an Acme grocery store in the small village of Lincroft, New Jersey, about 45 minutes' train ride from midtown Manhattan.

I grew up eating Attilio's, and it is to this day the standard by which I judge all other pizza.

The reason that I mention this is, the first time I took a bite out of a slice of Broadway pizza, I was instantly transported back to my childhood, biting into a crisp, thin crust topped with thin, subtly slightly sweet tomato sauce, just enough cheese and oregano.

Perfect, textbook NY/NJ style pizza and probably my 2nd favorite spot in town for this style of pizza - #1 being Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan - but here, you actually pay normal pizza prices for pizza instead of the gouging that happens at center Strip.

It's halfway across town from me but well worth the drive.

They have AMAZING customer service and everything made here feels very "homey" you can tell they take pride in everything they serve. I ordered a whole pizza pie and they made it exactly how i wanted i had four different pizzas all in one. The toppings are in every bite. The pizza slices are HUGE. Garlic knots were delicious and everything is a very reasonable price considering the sizes and topping of what we ordered. We got a whole pie two drinks 1/2 dozen garlic knots and a slice of cheesecake for $30. The only downside to this restaurant is there is no public bathroom. One more thing is they deliver pretty far for four dollars

Eh, it was okay.  Might have been better if we had eaten there instead of delivery.  Had a pizza, the spaghetti with sausage, side salads and garlic knots.

Pizza was eh, but again was warm at best.  Spaghetti sauce was eh as well, and not enough.  Sausage was spicy and good - the high light.  Garlic knots seemed a little lacking on the flavor.

Again, we did delivery and it may be much better when eaten hot out of the oven.
We have found this pizza to be the best in Vegas! We order at least once a week! The meat lovers is awesome and the thinly sliced sausage is fantastic.
Delivered exactly when they said they would! Incredible! Everyone at our little daughters party yesterday mentioned how great the pizza was. Everyone kept asking where we got it! Awesome!

I used to love this place when I lived in the neighborhood, but the quality of the food was not good when I went to revisit.

I ordered the Sicilian pizza, a salad, and my boyfriend ordered a small calzone.  His calzone was huge and tasty but my pizza was seriously overcooked and difficult to eat.  The cheese had already hardened again before it got to me.  Paid over 4$ for two glasses of soda and never even got a refill.  We probably will not be going back again.

This place, in a whole, is okay. I got delivery from it, so I cannot comment on the atmosphere of the actual establishment, so this review is strictly about the food. 

One of the bonuses to this place, as can be seen in the many photos is that it's pizzas are huge. If you order a large, you in fact, get an extremely large pizza. It's typical New York style pizza and is pretty greasy, ESPECIALLY if you get the pepperoni, which I wasn't exactly a fan of. They put plenty of toppings on the pizza and make sure that there aren't areas that are bare. I know of some other places that hurry to put toppings on, thus missing areas of the pizza. No beuno. They cater to special diets and have gluten free pizza (although I haven't tried it). This was handy since one of the people we were ordering for had a pork allergy. I like their ground beef pizza.. it wasn't as greasy as the others. OH, and their garlic knots. Yes. Those. They were by FAR my favorite thing about this place. Little carb pockets of goodness. If you ever go there, order some if you like bread. You won't be disappointed.

All and all, it's an okay place. Nothing really stands out about the pizza. It's better then fast food pizza for sure, but not AMAZING. Nothing I'd go out of my way to eat. If you are in the area and feel like some pizza that's a little better then fast food quality, sure, go for it. And remember, GET THE GARLIC KNOTS!

I am very tempted to give this 5 stars...  Everyone is looking for a good pizza joint and I think this will do the trick.  The atmosphere was ok a little on the run down side.  The service was good.

The menu was a mess - but popping off the menu was the "lunch special" and since it was lunch time it made sense.  

2 slices of cheese pizza and a drink for $5 ans some change.  NOt bad.  I added sausage for $1.  The slices are generous and they were very generous with the topping.

Okay - The pizza was excellent!  Thin crust with some crunch and it held up with out flopping.  Nice flavor too.  I am not sure how to describe good sausage other than it tasted good... so the sausage was good.

Overall - This is a must on the Vegas Pizza circuit!
Love this place!!! The wings are good. The pizza is to die for. I can eat here every week!

New York pizza at its finest. This awesome pizzeria is where it's at. I ordered the Large pizza of spinach to take home and boy it's delicious! The crust isn't to thin but just right and the toppings are very good. I love their wings. What can go wrong with pizza and wings ?! This place is reliable in serving a party with their large portions. 

It's located next to smiths in a tiny commercial building. Very small space, don't know if its family owned. But they sure are doing a great job in their business. I would like to try different toppings they have for their pizza next time I order for the family.

Absolutely the best pizza in Las Vegas. This is what real NY pizza is. Proper crust and just the right amount of cheese make it a perfect bite. The white pizza with the ricotta on it is sooo good! The veggie pizza is loaded with veggies! Prices are very reasonable. Only complaint here is with the buffalo wings; they were really, really small wings, overcooked, and not that great tasting. I still give it 5 stars though, just because of the pizza.

The first time I came here, I got two slices of cheese pizza and it was so tantalizingly good that I almost creamed myself.  The bottom was crunchy, the sauce was tangy, and the cheese was gooey, hot, and still bubbly.  Hands-down the best slice of pizza I've ever had.  

Imagine my delight when I found out my job was moving right around the corner from here!!! I've already ordered a new wardrobe the next size up because I'll be eating here a lot. 

$30.16 got me a large cheese pizza, twelve wings, 8 oz. of ranch dressing, and a small side dinner salad. I ordered takeout from here on Sunday 3-6-16.  

I asked for the wings only but my box had fries in it.  Hey, I'm not complaining; it just wasn't what I ordered.  The wings were small and on the dry side but I like my wings well done and they do provide additional sauce on the side without asking.  Their house-made ranch is extremely tasty so I got 8 ounces of it for my own "personal use".  

The pizza was sadly a bit disappointing compared to the first time I went here.  The crust was thick and fluffy.  I would rather have the thin, crunchy crust.  Maybe when you dine in and they pop the already-cooked slices in the oven to warm them up is when the magic happens.

*UPDATE* Many lunch pizza slices later I can confirm that the magic happens when the slices are re-heated!!!!

I been a big fan of Broadway pizza for quite some time know. My love affair with this joint started about ten years back when I used to work nearby and they would deliver their delicious wings to my job at the time. Thank you awesome past coworkers for introducing me to this true gem! Recently I have started coming back and dining in. Their customer service is on point! Talk about owning your business. Highly recommend everything on their menu. Their wings are too die for! No joke... I know my wings and they deliver...

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been coming here for years and usually when we go they know what we're having already. I appreciate establishments that pay attention to their customers and enjoy their jobs - which in turn ends up in great customer experience. Prices as very affordable, we usually can get a medium pepperoni, two sodas, an order of fries, and knots for under $30 dollars. I know it's taboo to think of ranch dressing at a pizzeria, but Broadway's ranch is amazing. I love having it with marinara and my knots, which by the way their knots are the best I've had in town. I always make the trip to Broadway when I'm in the mood for real pizza. It's hard for me to go to any other place! If you're a least in the area, this is a MUST GO place. It can really bust at lunch time, so be prepared for that if you go around that time!

I still love the food here but the no longer have a bathroom. So I won't go.  Their  Pizzas are great.  So are their appetizers and meals.  How can you have a food place with no bathroom for customers.  Who make decisions like this?

Sadly they are not consistent with their chicken wings, otherwise I would have given them 7 stars. 

The pizza is good and I can eat the crust because I want to, not because I don't want to waste food. 

The ranch is amazing. I would drink it if it wasn't even better on salads or wings. 

The wings, however, were amazing the first time I had them and rock hard and overcooked the second time. =((((

Yum I think we have found a new go to spot to add to our rotation of options for a good pizza pie!

My boyfriend and I just happened upon this joint via a coupon in the local edition of the 2013 entertainment guide as we wanted to try a new place. There was a coupon for 50% off of any pizza so I quickly yelped it and saw a four star rating. I read some of the reviews which boasted of their famous garlic knots as well so there we went to satisfy our pizza fix!

We decided on the 16' uptown white pizza (mozzarella), their other white pizza is made with ricotta cheese instead. We also got an order of one dozen garlic knots that come with a side of marinara sauce.

Wow, the pizza was delicious and drizzling with olive oil, and the garlic knots were fresh with butter and garlic! The crust and generous amount of cheese on the pizza was Amazing. I had an orgasm of flavor in my mouth and it felt and tasted so damn good!

They took $7.00 off of our pizza with the 50% off coupon we had so our large pizza and dozen garlic knots total only came to $12 which is a bargain for so much food!

We will be back and now we have a paper menu to review which is full of so many of their great food options to try!

We are fans!

My family and I have been going here for like 20 years. I love the meat lovers pizza and I'm not a huge fan of meat. The staff is cool never had any problem. The plaza is not the best but still worth it !!!

I wish I lived closer to Broadway Pizza.  This has got to be hands-down the most authentic New York/New Jersey pizza in all of Vegas.  Naysayers are probably used to some other city's poor imitation pizza wannabes.

I was ravenous, having just fasted for some minor eye surgery in a building fronting this shopping center.  Being slightly groggy from the local anesthesia didn't dull my taste buds.  The spinach/broccoli pizza we had was fabulous, the crust crisp and not oversalted, and it made me forget the pain that started to kick in just as I was wolfing down slice #1.   Though we ordered at the counter, the pizza was served to us, and the service was great, too.

Hubby said:  "Gee, this place isn't really THAT far."  

We'll be back, sooner rather than later, since he's already polished off two of the four leftover slices I froze to save for another quick dinner for us.  Fie!
Great pizza! The garlic knots were a little oily for my taste but, everything else was delicious. They are also very fast with take out orders.

So I just came back from NY like a week ago and I was already jones-in' for some NY-style pizza. Yelp to the rescue! This place is close to my school too, so I stopped by on my way out. I got a pepperoni to-go. It was only $3.50 with a can of soda! That's a deal!! The pizza is yummy with a nice crispy crust. Best part is that it's not overly greasy. I didn't feel like I was going to die after eating this. Highly recommend!!

We left the busy strip to try this place out. We are from Idaho and found this place on here. Excellent food and a great price! The food portions are awesome and it tasted great. I took my two little girls here with me and my wife... The waitress was super friendly and helpful. By far my most favorite place that I've eaten at in Las Vegas. The ranch sauce is unique and very good as well. Go here!

This place is very diverse with their menu, very quick with their food and their counter team sure know how to make an impression on their clientele. I ordered a few more items than my hands could handle and one of the team members came out from behind the counter, helped me with my drinks AND helped me carry out my items to my car. I felt really bad because the parking lot is always busy during lunch so I had to park far but he was more than happy to help. We ordered a pepperoni calzone, turkey sandwich, stuffed garlic knots and chicken fingers and fries. Not one of us was disappointed in our food. The calzone was fricken huge!!! See pictures! The stuffed garlic knots were stuffed with cheese and pepperoni, so filling. That could've been a meal of its own. I could smell the bbq on the chicken fingers before I even opened the bag. My nostrils were suddenly awakened by the spicy sauce smothered on the chicken fingers. And the sandwich was so big that half would've been sufficed. This place a great lunch spot for nearby businesses and even for dinner so if you want to stop by before heading home its a great place to go to.

I have heard about Broadway Pizzeria for years know from new yorkers. I was in the area so we decided to get a pizza to go. We got a cheese pizza and it was great!!! The place was packed and it was only about 4pm. The staff was very friendly. As i recently became vegetarian and trying to become a vegan i will return about one more time as i am not going to eat dairy anymore. I sure wish i started to go there years ago, as everything looked great. My three year old who is not a big eater ate two giant slices. What more can you say considering most pizza she eats she will only take a couple of bites. I am originally from the philly-new york area and it does rank up to the good pizza places back there.
